column1: A slim solution to store your keys

Keyper is a key organizer to store your keys. A new solution to the existing solutions in the market, it is a slim and sleek alternative to the bulky key pouches, noisy jigglings of a bunch of keys and the frequent misplacement of your keys.
""Make scratched phone screens and unsightly key bulges a thing of the past with Keyper""
""Keyper charmed us with its slim aesthetic supported by impeccable hand-craftsmanship""
""... a sleek key pouch that melds form and function""
""...a very simple way to simplify and change the way we use keys"" (reader's comment)
x No more jingling sounds from the cluttering of keys
x No more scratches on wallets or phones
Keyper can be stored easily into pockets of shirts, pants and bags without taking up much space.
4 color coded tabs allow for easy identification of different keys and also easy retrieval of each key for everyday usage.

An industrial adhesive on the inner face of the tab allows you to attach the tabs to your keys securely, before usage. All you have to do is to to loop the tab into the hole of the key, peel off the backing and press the two ends of the tabs together. The adhesive are water-resistant and will not fall apart in the event that it comes in contact with water.

Each piece of Keyper is meticulously sewn to perfection, highlighting the aesthetic sillouette of the keys. Made from genuine calf leather, it is highly durable and designed to be used for a long time.

By funding our campaign, we will be able to proceed with the actual manufacturing process of Keypers, which will require a minimum quantity to achieve the best lowest cost for you. We would also require funding for the final stage of design refinement, and packaging costs. To make our campaign a success, we need your support and contribution.

If you would like to have a Keyper of your own, please fund us now as we would need to keep the momentum going. Every dollar counts and we will really appreciate all your support to bring Keyper to reality.
Currently, with limited funds, we are only able to produce Keyper in one color. For us to manufacture Keyper in more variety of colors, we need your support and contribution in funding our campaign.
We are in the stage of product refinement and are looking into bringing in more colors for Keyper.

Below are some visualisations of colour variations which we would like to offer with your funding. You will be able to choose tabs in the colours you prefer, up to 4 different colours. Keyper may also be available in different base colours.
This will only be made possible if we have your support and achieve our funding goal.
End July: Shipping of first batch of Keypers
As it is our first crowdfunding campaign and our first mass produced design, there may be slight delays due to unforeseen circumstances.
Shipping time varies for different countries, we will be shipping out from Singapore. Please allow more time for shipping to the US and Europe.
1. What type of keys are supported by Keyper?
As Keyper is designed for common key types, most keys will fit Keyper. Keyper accomodates keys with a maximum length of 56mm.
If your current key does not fit, you can find a suitable key blank at your local hardware store and have it cut.
2. Will the leather will expand over time, causing the keys to fall out?

No, genuine leather and the design of stitching allows for the keys to be stored snuggly in the individual compartments. Leather may expand slightly over prolonged use, but expands to fit the shape of the keys, hence the keys will not fall out easily.
3. How long does it take for the item to arrive via international shipping?
Shipping time varies for different countries, typically 10-14 days.
$10 for international shipping, local shipping is free.
5. Is the Keyper made from genuine leather?
Yes, it is made from genuine calf leather, vegetable tanned and dyed.
6. What is the size of Keyper?
7. How do I choose the color that I want?
Once the campaign is successful and we have finalized the color variation, we will contact each of you via email, regarding your choice of color.

We feel that Keyper is a new and functional solution to safekeep your keys. Your contributions will assist us in the product refinement phase and also make it available to you at the lowest possible price.

Skulltec is a new and innovative safety product that fits comfortably under any sports helmet and lessens physical impact drastically.
In 2013, Bob Ferguson created the Skulltec cap. The cap is lab-tested, doctor recommended, universally recognized, and easily washable. It has been tested for comfort, fit, and protection.
The Skulltec cap not only protects what matters, it also looks good, feels good, and actually works.

At Skulltec, safety is, and will always be, the main focus. Being an athlete himself, and having two children in contact sports, Bob is familiar with the everyday dangers that an athlete encounters. Bob’s mission is to reduce the overall impact of collisions in sports, medicine, and construction by providing a top-of-the-line safety product. Skulltec will donate a percentage of its profits to groups that share similar views and are willing to join the campaign for safety.

If you, or a loved one plays a contact sport, uses a protective helmet for any reason, or simply puts your head in danger on a daily basis, Skulltec is the choice for you. 

Skulltec has researched numerous angles to access new customers business. Skulltec plans to reach millions of people in a very short time with one idea.
Targeting Extreme Sports Athletes and Everday Joes we can create awareness, sport, and trends with minimal risk.

With an experienced in-house team that handle branding/marketing/camera/dfx/web/smo/seo we are confident any task needed can be handled directly through our own channels of resources. This cuts down immensely in efficiency, cost, and quality control.
We are Skulltec. We want to be known as the premiere head impact safety product.

The Skulltec Cap is priced on the lower side of head protection products. Pricing of our products must remain initially competitive with our rivals. However, as Skulltec continues to grow and moves to more big box retailers we can compete with lower prices due to our superb profit margins.
Customers will buy our products directly through our website and its secure server and we will ship all ordered products from our warehouse.
The monies provided by you will be utilized to expand our product line and increase marketing awareness.

column10: >While jogging around his base, an Air Force officer kept arranging his ball cap to block the hot sun from his eyes and try to keep his head cool. He remembered how wearing a Kevlar helmet in the Persian Gulf was actually cooler than not wearing one, and set out to determine how to duplicate the cooling effects of the helmet into his ball cap. After some trial and error he came up with a revolutionary design based upon the principles of flight aerodynamics that can be incorporated into any ball cap or hat with a curved bill. By adding a second smaller bill under the main bill of a cap and creating a gap from the front to the back between the two bills, the two bills create a curved shape that acts like an airfoil, thus creating a high and low pressure system that funnels and accelerates the free flow of air over a wearer's forehead, inducing a cooling effect. It works no matter which direction the wind is coming from, and even generates cooling air flow whenever a person moves. Besides the benefit of a cooling effect, the appearance of the ball cap is such that an observer looking at someone wearing it would not notice if there was anything overtly different about the design of the ball cap. The end result?

column2: Cap which utilizes an airfoil effect for inducing cooling) and Trademark have already been issued for this incredible invention and prototypes have been hand produced.

column3: >The photo's of the various caps shown here are regular ball caps in which we've incorporated the AIRCAP technology to showcase the effectiveness of the design. Why did the AIRCAP receive a US Patent? Because the gap does more than just allow cool air in
column4: it ACCELERATES the flow of air between the bills and into the cap no matter which way the wind is blowing, using the principle of lift. It's one of those, ""why didn't I think of that"" products.

column1: The photos throughout this page demonstrate to potential manufacturers how the technology can be fitted to their own popular ball cap styles without altering the appearance of their products.  The AIRCAP shown above is a sample of what contributors will receive. This AIRCAP is in Special Forces Black.

It's the special insert that makes a regular ball cap an AIRCAP and we'd like to license (or sell) the AIRCAP technology to various manufacturers so they can contact their own ball cap suppliers to determine how best to incorporate the AIRCAP technology into their own designs.

The photos below show how we’ve incorporated the dual bill into normal ball caps to produce an AIRCAP. If you can help us launch this product by contributing and getting an AIRCAP, that we’ll manufacture just for this effort, and a little bit extra (all contained in the $49 and above perks) to cover operations, then you’ll have been part of the special effort that gets this product to market.

column3: >By achieving our funding goal we can obtain production level prototypes, as well as, deliver AIRCAPS to our supporters. Plus, we'd have the operational funds required to visit a few potential retailers in the USA that may be interested in incorporating the AIRCAP design into their own line of ball caps (Cabelas, Gander Mountain, PING, Callaway, Nike, Bass Pro Shops, Under Armour, Independent large retailers, etc.).

column2: >Everyone on the planet has, at one time, worn a ball cap. They're international, and they're sentimental. They tell people who you are, where you've been, what you like, and what your passions are. They bring good memories to life - unlike cold electronic gadgets that fade away with time. Ball caps are timeless. People that have ball caps own more than one, and buy them throughout their lifetime. Time and time again you've probably lifted the bill slightly off of your head to get some cooling air flowing over your head, or your ballcap shows an ugly sweat stain across the front. This design alleviates almost all of that!

column1: AIRCAP design can be applied to ball caps used for Golfing, Jogging, Marathons,
Hunting, Camping, Fishing, Walking around, and Bicycling - in other words, HUGE markets. The construction of the insert is rugged and can withstand the washing machine. Any
company that uses or manufactures ball caps can license the technology from
AIRCAP LLC, and pay a tiny royalty per AIRCAP produced and use their own
manufacturers to produce AIRCAP's to meet their unique customer demands - PLUS,
as noted, the market demand is international!

column5:
>

In two years of beta testing, every single

column1: person who has worn an AIRCAP swears it is the best ball cap
that they have ever worn. The AIRCAP is designed to provide cooling no matter which direction the wind is coming from.
When we asked Loryn, the model on the left, how the AIRCAP worked during the photo shoot, she said, ""TOTALLY worked! Stayed nice and cool on a hot Hawaii Sunday at the Beach!!""
So, please contribute TODAY and help launch a global product!

column2: >What the Funds will be used for:

column1: • Funds will  be used to buy enough samples to market and showcase the product design to potential retailers for incorporation into their own designs and reward our investors. The minimum production order of prototypes is 1,440 AIRCAPS. Those will be used to reward all of our supporters, demonstrate the feasibility of manufacture, collect sample costing data (cost of goods), and demonstrate the technology to manufacturers.  An AIRCAP online store will be created, and we'll go back to all of our contributors and ask for official endorsements and comments, which we'll place on our website.

• We also need to hit the road and demonstrate the AIRCAP to potential clients who will license the technology (The Dolby Model) and use their own manufacturers to incorporate the design into their already proven and popular ballcaps. This includes companies like Callaway Golf, Ping Golf, Nike, Under Armour, Bass Pro Shop, Cabela's, Gander Mountain, National Baseball teams, etc. These funds will cover the costs to accomplish this goal. At the $25K goal level we estimate we'll be able to visit at least the top 10 in our priority list.
  • If we obtain enough funding, we plan to purchase advertising to reach as large an audience as possible and complete our priority list of visits to large manufacturers. Such advertising can run $250K or more, so sufficient investment or sales would have to be in-hand, backed by a market and ROI analysis before we commit such funding.

• Be in on the ground floor of the first major change to ball cap design since they were invented.  In the ""Perks"" section the differing amounts invested DO NOT correlate to the anticipated retail price of the AIRCAP, so while $49, for example, gets you an AIRCAP, that's a token of our thanks and not the retail price of the AIRCAP, which will be set by each vendor that purchases a license to produce them. This is our way of saying, ""Thank You"" for your support.
• Once we achieve at least $10,000 in funding - enough to buy a production run of AIRCAPS, then all AIRCAP investors who have contributed $49 or more will receive their AIRCAPS.

column2: >While we obtain interest from major vendors we will also sell AIRCAPs directly through AIRCAP LLC. All such AIRCAPS will be made with ""Air Flow"" a special material that allows the passage of air through the surface of the ball cap making the design even more effective. Other manufacturers who will offer AIRCAPs may incorporate other materials.
>On the AIRCAP website we will acknowledge all backers who will have helped make the dream come true!

column1: <li>Often the most simple ideas make the most money, the Hula Hoop, ShamWow, Oxy Clean, etc. What makes them special? The products appeal to everyone and they have a ""stickiness"" that keeps customers coming back for more! Ball caps are universal - everyone on the planet has seen, worn, or purchased a ball cap and they're enduring
column2:
people go through hundreds of caps in a lifetime - and they appeal to adults and children. AIRCAPS have instant mass market appeal because the design blends in and can be incorporated into popular ball caps designs on the market offered through numerous vendors.
  • The AIRCAP team is an entrepreneurial pair that has developed and managed everything from a super cleaning gel (DeconGel - see decongel.com) to a semi-perpetual self-charging battery - all with approved patents, and have taken these ideas and developed successful businesses.
  • Additionally, the team is comprised of retired military members and if there is one organization left in the USA that is trustworthy, it's our military!

column1: • With all products of this type the major risk is counterfeit products. While the AIRCAP has an issued US Patent, patents only mean something to people and companies that obey our laws. The AIRCAP business model is a licensing model, but we will always retain the right to sell directly to all markets under our AIRCAP brand. With that said, the primary emphasis will be on licensing the technology to companies that have the financial clout and connections with Customs and Border Control to fight counterfeit AIRCAPS. If some company wants exclusive rights, then that's OK with us.

• The AIRCAP technology is not an insert. Ball caps must be made with the technology incorporated, however, that isn't to say that an insert kit can't be made to retrofit a non-aircap ball cap into an AIRCAP.

• The other challenge will be price points. Ballcaps come at all price points with high quality, major league and franchised ballcaps costing $75 or more. However, you can get a cheap ballcap with a plastic mesh screened back that costs less than $7 at any gas station. We envision that the AIRCAP will only be made to high quality standards, using premium materials and will target the higher quality ballcap market. With that said, larger companies with more purchasing clout will be able to set price points anywhere along the continuum for ball caps.

• Another challenge will be market penetration, however we anticipate that all of you will help us get the word out through word of mouth and social media advertising, as well as, point us and/or introduce us to people that you think will be good spokespeople for the product/technology.

LIFT - AIRCAP, AIRPLANES and SAILBOATS - How does the AIRCAP work with a main bill and a under bill? The secret is how sailboats can sail against the wind and how they can sail FASTER than the wind is blowing! Air just doesn't blow into the gap of an AIRCAP, airflow is ACCELERATED between the bills of an AIRCAP, just like the mainsail and a jib on a sailboat, thus rocketing airflow over your head!
• If you can't contribute but believe in the idea then please spread the word about AIRCAP and ask your retailer to stock them.
• Share the information about the AIRCAP on Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.

• Send other people to this site and we'll keep a database of referrals. For every $99 or more in contributions you refer we'll give you an AIRCAP with the AIRCAP Logo on the front, or an AIRCAP T-Shirt.
• Want to talk to us directly? Email ljstack@gmail.com or ramerj@att.net

And that's all there is to it.

","The AIRCAP Story

While jogging around his base, an Air Force officer kept arranging his ball cap to block the hot sun from his eyes and try to keep his head cool. He remembered how wearing a Kevlar helmet in the Persian Gulf was actually cooler than not wearing one, and set out to determine how to duplicate the cooling effects of the helmet into his ball cap. After some trial and error he came up with a revolutionary design based upon the principles of flight aerodynamics that can be incorporated into any ball cap or hat with a curved bill. By adding a second smaller bill under the main bill of a cap and creating a gap from the front to the back between the two bills, the two bills create a curved shape that acts like an airfoil, thus creating a high and low pressure system that funnels and accelerates the free flow of air over a wearer's forehead, inducing a cooling effect. It works no matter which direction the wind is coming from, and even generates cooling air flow whenever a person moves. Besides the benefit of a cooling effect, the appearance of the ball cap is such that an observer looking at someone wearing it would not notice if there was anything overtly different about the design of the ball cap. The end result?
The Amazing AIRCAP!!  A US Patent (US Patent 8,640,264
column2: Cap which utilizes an airfoil effect for inducing cooling) and Trademark have already been issued for this incredible invention and prototypes have been hand produced.

By achieving our funding goal we can obtain production level prototypes, as well as, deliver AIRCAPS to our supporters. Plus, we'd have the operational funds required to visit a few potential retailers in the USA that may be interested in incorporating the AIRCAP design into their own line of ball caps (Cabelas, Gander Mountain, PING, Callaway, Nike, Bass Pro Shops, Under Armour, Independent large retailers, etc.).

Everyone on the planet has, at one time, worn a ball cap. They're international, and they're sentimental. They tell people who you are, where you've been, what you like, and what your passions are. They bring good memories to life - unlike cold electronic gadgets that fade away with time. Ball caps are timeless. People that have ball caps own more than one, and buy them throughout their lifetime. Time and time again you've probably lifted the bill slightly off of your head to get some cooling air flowing over your head, or your ballcap shows an ugly sweat stain across the front. This design alleviates almost all of that!
AIRCAP design can be applied to ball caps used for Golfing, Jogging, Marathons,
Hunting, Camping, Fishing, Walking around, and Bicycling - in other words, HUGE markets. The construction of the insert is rugged and can withstand the washing machine. Any
company that uses or manufactures ball caps can license the technology from
AIRCAP LLC, and pay a tiny royalty per AIRCAP produced and use their own
manufacturers to produce AIRCAP's to meet their unique customer demands - PLUS,
as noted, the market demand is international!
In two years of beta testing, every single
person who has worn an AIRCAP swears it is the best ball cap
that they have ever worn. The AIRCAP is designed to provide cooling no matter which direction the wind is coming from.
When we asked Loryn, the model on the left, how the AIRCAP worked during the photo shoot, she said, ""TOTALLY worked! Stayed nice and cool on a hot Hawaii Sunday at the Beach!!""
So, please contribute TODAY and help launch a global product!
What We Need & What You Get
What the Funds will be used for:

Funds will  be used to buy enough samples to market and showcase the product design to potential retailers for incorporation into their own designs and reward our investors. The minimum production order of prototypes is 1,440 AIRCAPS. Those will be used to reward all of our supporters, demonstrate the feasibility of manufacture, collect sample costing data (cost of goods), and demonstrate the technology to manufacturers.  An AIRCAP online store will be created, and we'll go back to all of our contributors and ask for official endorsements and comments, which we'll place on our website.

We also need to hit the road and demonstrate the AIRCAP to potential clients who will license the technology (The Dolby Model) and use their own manufacturers to incorporate the design into their already proven and popular ballcaps. This includes companies like Callaway Golf, Ping Golf, Nike, Under Armour, Bass Pro Shop, Cabela's, Gander Mountain, National Baseball teams, etc. These funds will cover the costs to accomplish this goal. At the $25K goal level we estimate we'll be able to visit at least the top 10 in our priority list. If we obtain enough funding, we plan to purchase advertising to reach as large an audience as possible and complete our priority list of visits to large manufacturers. Such advertising can run $250K or more, so sufficient investment or sales would have to be in-hand, backed by a market and ROI analysis before we commit such funding.

Be in on the ground floor of the first major change to ball cap design since they were invented.  In the ""Perks"" section the differing amounts invested DO NOT correlate to the anticipated retail price of the AIRCAP, so while $49, for example, gets you an AIRCAP, that's a token of our thanks and not the retail price of the AIRCAP, which will be set by each vendor that purchases a license to produce them. This is our way of saying, ""Thank You"" for your support.
Once we achieve at least $10,000 in funding - enough to buy a production run of AIRCAPS, then all AIRCAP investors who have contributed $49 or more will receive their AIRCAPS.

While we obtain interest from major vendors we will also sell AIRCAPs directly through AIRCAP LLC. All such AIRCAPS will be made with ""Air Flow"" a special material that allows the passage of air through the surface of the ball cap making the design even more effective. Other manufacturers who will offer AIRCAPs may incorporate other materials.
On the AIRCAP website we will acknowledge all backers who will have helped make the dream come true!

The products appeal to everyone and they have a ""stickiness"" that keeps customers coming back for more! Want to talk to us directly? Email ljstack@gmail.com or ramerj@att.net
And that's all there is to it.",13.0,2,"1 Campaign

In order to make Carnage et Clemency a viable, income-generating business I need help with the following:

Creative Team – Talented models, photographers and stylists have donated their time to create stunning visuals for CetC…. however I can't keep leaning on their generosity! To get off the ground, I need to schedule photo-shoots that provide compensation to collaborators.

Packaging – My goal for CetC is to have 100% post-consumer recycled packing &
column2:
shipping materials. I intend to source these materials from EcoEnclose.com. My first order will cost upwards of $100.

Graphics – Computer geniuses, ahoy! I am hoping to hire a graphic designer to help perfect a company logo and shop banner.

Classes – Ongoing education is essential to keeping a small business relevant. Sewing and hand-altering classes cost $40 - $60 a pop and help me improve my skill set.

More about Carnage et Clemency...

▲Timeless

▲Los Angeles Inspired

▲Sustainable

What's my Vintage Philosophy?

I have always loved vintage but I don't want to live in costume. Wool suits, stiff polyester and 80's prom dresses? No thank you. I believe vintage should fit seamlessly into your wardrobe without having an obvious date stamp.

What's my Vintage Style?

I live in a wild, weird, industrial arts space in downtown Los Angeles and confront the harshness and beauty of living an urban artist's lifestyle everyday. My neighbors are engineers, designers, painters and geniuses. I take inspiration from this environment and try to inject CetC with some of its grace and grit.

Why shop at CetC?

With our planet in jeopardy, shopping second-hand and vintage can be a moral, holistic choice. CetC's products are acquired sustainably and hand-altered in a shared art space. Shipping materials are 100% recycled post-consumer.


More...

This beautiful vintage black lace dress is pictured above in an editorial-style shot and below in the studio. Ideally, I would like to shoot my clothes in both styles to create a lookbook blog that would reroute customers to my storefront. Unfortunately, photoshoots are one of the more expensive factors in running a successful vintage company on Etsy. Donate and you're not just helping me, you are helping an entire artistic team practice their passions and produce collaborative art!


Photo by Christian Meola | www.christianmeola.com

0,"


Hello Everyone,

Thank you so much for coming by this part of the universe to perhaps help my dreams . I have been making plant based products for 10 years . After all this time, I have discovered something truly unique to my craft + would love to grow my business .
column2:
/>

Plant Makeup is a new, but ancient way of beautifying . It marries the intense 21st century need for using makeup + beauty products, with plant + environmental awareness .


My mission is simply to inspire the up and coming generation : you can do anything ... but at the same time, be mindful of environmental impact and also be aware of how much we really need in life . My aim is not to turn into a gigantic corporation one day . I wish to simply grow my inventory so I can meet the blossoming desire for my products .


I have been running my etsy shop :: good4you.etsy.com :: for almost 6 years solo style . With your funding help I will purchase more supplies + continue to spread love + hire a helping hand + you will be helping a small handmade indie project grow .


 Your help will go so far, because my eyes see solutions to environmental conservation, awareness + education . I am an artist purely . Plant Makeup is a medium that goes far beyond a small business, it can help save the planet . 

Yours Truly,

 Jes

column1: To mark the final 7 days of the crowdfunding campaign coinciding with Fair Tuesday, 25% of purchases made from November 27th-December 2nd 2012, will be donated to sponsor orphans or severely at risk children in Rishikesh, India.

UNA Fashion is proud to be a partner of the Fair Tuesday initiative. The goal of #FairTuesday is to inspire conscious consumption and show how as a consumer, you have the power to create positive change! Find out more about the movement here.

Volunteering and spending time with several schools and orphanages throughout India was an eye opener for me. It also reinforced the belief that every child has a right to education and it is a vital tool for peace, development and freedom. The sponsorship will provide everything from proper nutrition (mostly from their own organic garden), healthcare, education, books and a home with a family of 60+ children full of compassion and love.

Help UNA Fashion finish strong by making a pledge and sharing the campaign with your social networks, family and friends! 80% funded and only 6 days to go! I am overwhelmed and grateful for your continued support! Thank you!!!
Last winter I set out for India to bring my vision for UNA Fashion to life.
My mission was to create a label where a purchase has a direct and positive impact on people and our precious planet. A label that follows the principles of the slow fashion movement
column2: to choose well and make it last. Therefor, a collection designed to be durable, timeless and functional. Lastly, a label to inspire the movement for conscious consumerism. Understanding that together, our power as consumer can change the world!

column1: I left for India not knowing exactly where my mission would take me. The past 7 months have been a whirlwind to bring UNA Fashion to where is it today. From finding the best eco-materials, artisans, and perfecting the designs
column2: the journey has been challenging and immensely rewarding. Finally, the eco-leather bags and scarfs are ready for you!

column1: Artisans in fair trade certified organizations craft the original designs. The groups have incredible missions beyond the World Trade Organization Fair Trade principles. They are tackling poverty and socials injustices by providing programs and support beyond employment. Visit my blog where I share stories and faces behind our line.
Being an early supporter gives you the chance get a great deal, with free shipping worldwide! You have your choice of one of the three ModPacks (Original, Three-Way or Wanderlust)  &
column2: a scarf for only $145! Only 15 available!

column1: The eco-leather collection is made entirely with biodegradable leather free from chrome, harsh chemicals and heavy metals. The Indian tannery extends the environmental considerations to all parts of the value chain, and have truly revolutionized the tanning process. Find out more about the wonderful owners and their genuine passion to better the world here.
You have a choice of 3 different eco-leathers, each with unique character. UNA Fashion is the first in the world to use two of these leathers!
• Chestnut: Softest, full grain leather, with a touch of shine
• Chocolate: Soft, full grain leather, with a vintage look
A simple cotton bag with a powerful story of hope.

An organic cotton dust bag (to keep your product beautiful for years to come) is included with the scarfs and eco-leather perks. It is another detail to maximize our social impact. They are made by women rescued from the sex trade in Sonagachi, Kolkata. With over 11,000 sex trade workers, it is one of the largest red light districts in Asia. The bag is made right in that same neighborhood, to create change from within.
Visit here to find out why I'm dedicated to using organic cotton.

Shipping is free anywhere in the world for the $25 (Organic Cotton Carry All), $55 (Silk Scarf) $145 (Early Bird) perks. All other leather bags perks include free shipping to Canada and the U.S. Please add $20 for internationalshipping.
• Belt measurement smallest hole: Holes are along the entire length of belt.
Support UNA - Watch our campaign video, and consider a making a pledge, which gets you first access to our line of eco bags and scarfs.
Join UNA – Join the movement to Fashion the Change. Connect with us online and let us know about your story, what you are working to change, and let's inspire more people.
Share UNA – Spread the word by sharing our story with friends to help us reach as many people as possibly.
Post our campaign link ( http://www.indiegogo.com/unafashion ) on Twitter, Facebook, &
Like UNA- Like the Facebook page and stay in the loop!
Tweet UNA – Tweet about @UNA_FashionInc and our campaign. If you like simplicity, simply copy and paste this...
Support @UNA_FashionInc launch their collection of eco-eather bags &
column2: handloomed silk scarfs and join the movement to #FashionTheChange !

column1: First, choose your desired pledge level, and the perk you would like to receive. You may choose to remain anonymous, but I'd love to know who are and any comments and feedback you may have. Leave me your addresses/ social media information as needed. Choose between the Indiegogo and Paypal checkout. You do not need a Paypal account to use this option. Lastly, enter your payment information- and receive my gratitude instantaneously…and your perk on the estimated delivery! Prior to delivery, I will be in touch to confirm your color and leather selection, and which ModPack you would like for the Early Bird Special.
2. When will I get my reward? Will it be in time for Christmas?

See the pledge level for specific delivery estimates. My goal is to ship everything in December, however, there may be some further surprises that sneak up. Therefor, I can't promise everything will be delivered in time for Christmas, which is why I have estimated the eco-leather deliveries for January. I will give updates throughout the campaign.
3. Do you have any men’s bags?
The Messenger bag is perfectly practical for both men and women. Leather is the perfect durable textile for being both elegant and rugged, appealing to all.
More questions? Ask me in the comments, or contact me directly at meg@unafashion.com
This campaign came together with the help of some very talented individuals, spanning the globe, who I'm extremely grateful to!
Thank you Adrienne Surprenant, for putting together the campaign video! She is Montreal based and you can view her stunning photography and film portfolio here.
Thank you to the lovely models in the video: Laure-Élie Michaud, Myriam Rafla, Arthur Gauthier &
Kelsey James is the composer of, Fall To, the song used in the video. She recently released an awesome new album which you can find on her Bandcamp Page.

Many of the photographs you will see throughout my website and Facebook page, including the above leather product shots, were done by Katlyn Murray. She did UNA's first shoot in India, and this globetrotter is in California at the moment!
Lastly, thank you Lauren Jones, and your wonderful flare for design!

column2: Useful is what I aspire to when designing these clothes,  along with ethical manufacturing standards and quality materials. I aim for every piece to feel special &amp
column3: to add beauty to your life. This has been a life long love and I've been practicing and honing my craft for many years. I want wearing these pieces to feel like lovely adventure. Every day you get a chance to invent yourself.

column1: <h3>With this ‘Transitional’ capsule collection we’re thinking a little outside the traditional, seasonal fashion box, What is currently being shown is ‘Resort’, so you can call this Resort if you like, but I think Transition makes more sense for today’s world. (okay, ‘Transition-Resort’

I wanted this collection to be both seasonless and seasonal, if that’s possible. Lifestyle, climate, where and how we live have a lot to do with how we dress. With this small group I hope to give you some versatile and beautiful pieces that you will enjoy wearing  when it’s warm, when it’s cool and in between. Casual, dressy or somewhere in the middle, it just has to work. Providing beauty, value, usefulness. Well-made, modern clothes with lovely details that are fun, pretty and practical.
*The Images seen in the GALLERY section are from the ‘Transition’ collection, many of which represent the PERKS* we're offering.

I believe good clothes serve you better and thus are more sustainable. These are not meant to be discarded seasonally or quickly replaced with the next trend,  but to be enjoyed for as long as you love wearing them.  Any new items purchased will just build upon the pieces that you love. It isn’t so much about fashion trends as it is about style that endures.  I have a love affair with good fabric
column3: some practicality wrapped in a beautiful package is what I look for. L<strong>ife would be a bit sad without good coffee &amp
column4: chocolate. The same goes for good clothes.

column1: *Beauty is a necessity in life, that’s why beautiful is useful.

<h3><strong> We make everything locally in Los Angeles. At the moment everything is done on a small scale – old-fashioned atelier style – no mass production, mostly limited edition. This is not easy in a mass-produced, super trendy, cheap labor, hyper PR fashion world,  but it is what I love to do.  I love the craft and the connection with people wearing what we’ve created.  While we aspire to greater success, more sales &amp
column2: exposure, we intend to preserve the integrity of the product and continue strive toward ethical manufacturing standards. I really believe in the progress of small business entrepreneurs. I feel there’s a growing desire toward conscious commerce.  We feel good about knowing and connecting with where our stuff comes from and with the people that make it. It creates greater intimacy with the things we use.

column1: *kaj.ani was on hiatus for a while, we now bring it back with this collection.
<h3><strong> With your support we’ll be able to get this small collection produced &amp
column2: out to market, and create work for people.  We’ll also be able to get our Spring-Summer 2014 collection started and have the prototypes made. I am so grateful for your help in any capacity. Sharing this project with friends &amp
column3: on socail media is greatly appreciated.  Besides feeling good about helping us re-launch, to achieve our mission and put people to work, the other great perk is getting these clothes WHOLESALE! (all prices listed are wholesale)  I hope you really enjoy the clothes &amp
column4: Please know that you have my eternal gratitude!

Tell us about your style, sizing, and the issues that you care about most.
We send you a variety of clothes from the latest cool + conscious brands that fit what you are looking for. Clothes that look good + do good, curated just for you by a personal stylist.

column2:
>

 

Keep what you love, return what you don’t. Finally! It's easy to choose clothes that reflect all of who you are.

column1: Be a part of something bigger. Together, we can collectively challenge the $3+ trillion fashion industry to work more for human rights, workers' rights, sustainability, and positive impact in the lives of so many around the world.

12+ million garment workers make the clothing we wear every day. Too often, these people are in unsafe conditions and grossly underpaid. Consider the shirt you have on right now - do you know who made it? Does she or he have a safe working environment or access to clean water?

These questions inspired us to look for alternatives - and we’re thinking big. Join us in a movement to motivate the fashion industry to change. As wearwell connects more people to consciously-made clothing, the collective demand and buying power of conscious consumers grows.
We envision a world where companies compete for customers not just on price but on their reputation for human rights and sustainability. This vision starts with you.

If you select a perk that includes a pre-order, you’ll receive an exclusive pre-order code to join wearwell in the weeks shortly after the Indiegogo campaign closes. The code is your ticket into wearwell and covers our styling fee for your first order. Each time you keep an item from your order, we'll waive that fee next time. Please note: right now, wearwell can only serve customers with a mailing address in the US.

column1: Each piece is chosen from high-quality, fashion-forward lines that ""walk the talk"" when it comes to making an impact. Your box includes information on the positive social and environmental impact generated by your purchase.
Keep what you love, send back what you don't. Simple. You'll only ever pay for the items you keep. Guaranteed.
Your pre-order code - once redeemed - covers the styling fee and shipping both ways. Even if you keep just one item from the box and we'll waive the fee for your next order!

We search high and low for brands and suppliers that meet our standards for environmental and workers' rights. These standards were developed by us, the founders, while earning our Master's degrees at the American University School of International Service, and are based on research developed by leading global entities, including the ILO, Fair Trade USA, and Conservation International.  As wearwell grows, we will continue to monitor our standards alongside changes and advancements in the apparel industry to ensure that the brands we carry continue to meet our high expectations.

Right now, we have a website built and ready to serve our backers. In order to market more widely and serve even more people, we will use the capital you are helping us to raise to build a site savvy enough to handle a higher volume of orders and enhance the experience for our initial backers + future customers. We also need to invest in human capital, hiring additional hands, talented stylists, and more.

Finding the brands that we carry is challenging work, and unfortunately it's cost-prohibitive to fly to factories to check on working conditions and local environments. We are working with self-reported data from our suppliers. We pledge to be transparent and direct with our customers

Once you receive your pre-order code, you’ll create a profile and tell us all about your style and what you care about. From there, we’ll select specific items and you can expect a box within 4-6 weeks - a bit longer than we’ll take in the future. We are a startup and know that some hurdles are simply unpredictable in the early stages. But don’t worry
column2: we’ll keep you updated every step of the way. We appreciate your patience!

Emily have over 15 years of experience in international development, global operations, marketing, sales, and communications. Erin is based in the US and Emily is based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia - the emerging hub for consciously-made apparel.

column1: We wanted to buy our clothes from brands that do good for others and for the planet. But shopping consciously is a lot of work. Who has time to hunt down brands that suit your style, your budget, and what you care about?
We knew there had to be a better way. With our backgrounds in working for change around the globe, we decided to do something about it.
Be a Part of Something MUCH Bigger

In April 2013, the Rana Plaza Factory collapsed in Bangladesh, killing 1,000+ and injuring 2,400+, garnering international headlines about the practices of some of the US' and UK's largest clothing brands who were involved. But solutions to human rights and environmental challenges in the fashion industry are much more complicated than they seem and it's no single brand or company's fault. What's more, simply abandoning production in Bangladesh and countries with similar challenges would collapse economies, causing even deeper poverty. We are a long way from a conscious fashion industry, but we believe it can be done. (If you want to learn more, we recommend watching The True Cost - available on Netflix.)

When you fund wearwell, you’re beginning to solve the problem. By helping to build a service that allows people to easily find beautiful, quality clothes they can feel great about purchasing, you are collectively challenging the fashion industry to work more for human rights, sustainability, and improving the lives of so many people around the world.
If you can't financially contribute, you can still be a part of the movement. Help us make some noise!
• share the campaign over social (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, whatever works for you!)
• send an email with a link to your friends who you think will love wearwell
• connect us with people you think might be able to help by emailing info@shopwearwell.com.
• follow us on social media and sign up for our emails

column1: Tell us about your style, sizing, and the issues that you care about most.
We send you a variety of clothes from the latest cool + conscious brands that fit what you are looking for. Clothes that look good + do good, curated just for you by a personal stylist.
Keep what you love, return what you don’t. Finally! It's easy to choose clothes that reflect all of who you are.

Be a part of something bigger. Together, we can collectively challenge the $3+ trillion fashion industry to work more for human rights, workers' rights, sustainability, and positive impact in the lives of so many around the world.

12+ million garment workers make the clothing we wear every day. Too often, these people are in unsafe conditions and grossly underpaid. Consider the shirt you have on right now - do you know who made it? Does she or he have a safe working environment or access to clean water?

These questions inspired us to look for alternatives - and we’re thinking big. Join us in a movement to motivate the fashion industry to change. As wearwell connects more people to consciously-made clothing, the collective demand and buying power of conscious consumers grows.
We envision a world where companies compete for customers not just on price but on their reputation for human rights and sustainability. This vision starts with you.

If you select a perk that includes a pre-order, you’ll receive an exclusive pre-order code to join wearwell in the weeks shortly after the Indiegogo campaign closes. The code is your ticket into wearwell and covers our styling fee for your first order. Each time you keep an item from your order, we'll waive that fee next time. Please note: right now, wearwell can only serve customers with a mailing address in the US.
Peruse the perks with details here!
Can't decide? Choose a whole collection:
Or even travel to India and Cambodia with us!
Check out the details of the trip.

New Reward: Shirt, Handwritten Thank You, and Cell Phone Screen Savers

To fund the manufacturing and packaging, as well as a new website for Hello Beautiful!, we need to raise $6,500. Currently, we have invested $3,000 into creating our current packaging and purchasing supplies.
What are your Hello Beautiful! Lipstick ingredients?

Our lipsticks contain USDA certified organic and non-gmo project verified ingredients. Certified kosher beeswax, Fair trade organic cocoa butter, Organic green tea oil, non-gmo avocado oil, Fair trade organic shea butter, non-nanoparticle iron oxides, Filtered candelilla wax, Organic turmeric root powder.

According to a study done by the University of Georgia’s Selig Center in 2015, the U.S. multicultural beauty product market grew 3.7 % in 2014, outpacing the growth of the overall cosmetic market. Although the multicultural cosmetic market is growing, there is not a brand that combines clean, safe, and non-toxic organic ingredients with multicultural skin needs – until Hello Beautiful!

column6: >Our expected delivery date is between late January 2016 and early February 2016. Due to the handmade nature of the cosmetic bags, more time is needed in the production process. However, we are in talks with the manufacturer and are confident that we will be able to meet this timeline.

column1: When will my Key Chain or Compact mirror arrive?

Our expected delivery date is between late January 2016 and early February 2016. The Key Chain are made by women with the fair trade Freeset organization, which offers employment to women previously trapped in the sex trade in Kolkata, India. The Compact Mirrors are custom laser engraved by John Guillory of MJLaserArt.
Tell me more about the fair trade Cosmetic Bags.

Our cosmetic bags are made by women with the fair trade Freeset organization, which offers employment to women previously trapped in the sex trade in Kolkata, India. Each woman is employed full-time, has access to health benefits, and is able to supply income for herself and her family.
Join Hello Beautiful! On a beautiful journey! ¡Hola Bonita! Bonjour Beau!
For the woman who is God’s masterpiece. (Eph. 2:10)

Introduction

The Wõitleja from Estonia1918 is more than just an extraordinary wristwatch: it is a literal time machine, connecting two moments a hundred years apart, and celebrating a tiny nation’s resilience through an exceptionally challenging and turbulent period in history. The brainchild of an enthusiastic young designer, fabricated by an aerospace engineer and finished by an artisan jeweler, the Wõitleja is the Estonian spirit distilled into a physical form. It is a permanent token of the resolve and ingenuity which a century ago helped a tiny nation beat back two invading empires, and today still helps it punch above its weight in freedom and innovation.

Limited to a run of no more than a hundred items, the Wõitleja (Estonian for Freedom Fighter) has been selected as part of the official celebrations of the Republic of Estonia’s centennial anniversary. Read More Here

The History

After eight centuries of continued occupation by foreign powers – first the Crusaders, then various colonial empires – Estonia declared itself an independent nation on February 24th, 1918. It was immediately attacked on two sides, by the Red Army of Soviet Russia, and by the German Empire’s Landeswehr.

Within two years, Estonian soldiers had beaten back both enemies, and secured their country’s independence. Estonia’s secret weapons were the Armored Trains – massive rail bound war machines that traveled fast and delivered overwhelming firepower.

The name Wõitleja initially belonged to the artillery car of Armored Train Nr. 2, and the watch’s design is directly inspired by the intricate workmanship of bronze gauges found on the heavy military equipment of the First World War era.

The Look

1918-era locomotives were festooned with bronze gauges, used to tell steam pressure and other vital parameters. These gauges had to be sturdy, but easy to read from a distance, through smoke, in the cab of a train running at full speed. Over time, the metal developed a beautiful patina that gives the items a distinguished masculine appearance. This was the inspiration for the Wõitleja by Estonia1918.

The timepiece is designed to be compact and thin, but look large on the wrist. Its case is machined whole from a single block of true old-school CuSn8 brass, a marine-grade alloy of brass and tin that was developed to be submerged in saltwater for a lifetime without corrosion. Exposed to skin and air, it will build up a unique patina that testifies to decades of faithful service.

The dial face, adorned by sword-shaped lumed hands and complemented by the brass indexes that form part of the case itself, is hand-crafted and covered in deep black enamel by an artisan jeweler from Roman Tavast, the same person who creates Estonia’s decorations of state – including the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, the highest honor that can be awarded to non-Estonians for outstanding service to the country’s independence.

The dial face is covered by sapphire crystal, and sapphire is also used in the waterproof exhibition caseback that both protects and presents the specially embellished Swiss movement. With a 44mm diameter and a height of only 11mm, the thin bezels, enamel dial and machined indexes combine to generate a three-dimensional legibility that enable you to easily tell the time at a glance, from a distance.

The watch comes with a selection of military-inspired straps, but will take the owner’s choice of standard 24mm strap, in cloth, leather, or metal that are attached to the watch case with strong screwdown strapbars. Each watch carries a unique serial number between 1 and 100, with number 1 reserved for the watch to be given to the President of Estonia.

The Perks

1 out of 100 Wõitleja Wristwatch

Estonian Coat of Arms Pinion for the strap or to be worn separately

 

The Technology

 

The watch designer’s extensive IT experience came in handy in Estonia’s famously tight-knit digital community, known in Silicon Valley as the Estonian Mafia. For the machining of the bronze case and the final assembly of this limited-run centennial timepiece, he drafted in aerospace engineers who spend their days building satellites.

The Wõitleja was intended to look as large as possible on the wrist, while maintaining a reasonable physical size. As a military-style watch, it also needed to be practical, which meant serviceable by any competent watchmaker around the world. Despite a broad choice of available movements, only one fit all the criteria: an upgraded variant of the Swiss-made Unitas 6497-2. This more precise and more durable version beats at 3Hz, has 19 jewels instead of the usual 17, and its matte gold plating can be admired through the transparent sapphire caseback. The watch is held together by titanium screws in extruded pods, with hex heads instead of the more classic phillips, to give a subtle clue to future generations that this timepiece was actually made in 2016, not 1918.

The dial fabrication process starts by making a die in a CNC machine. The machine engraves the letters “ESTONIA” onto the mold with a precision of 1 micron. Then the die is taken to a press that stamps out the base of the dial, already lettered and curved at the edges. Pure enamel powder (essentially tiny glass particles) that has been washed several times is added to the base of dial, fired at temperatures of over 800 degrees Celsius. At that point, the powder liquefies and fuses to the base of the dial. Once cooled, the process is repeated with the next layer of enamel powder. Altogether, between five and ten coats are applied to produce the desired color and thickness.

When the firing is finished, the enamel is polished to a mirror finish. The entire dial creation process is incredibly time-consuming, even for an enameller with over twenty years of experience. Enamel gives the dial an extremely deep black color that will never fade. Since the enamel dials are known as the most durable dial types in the history of watchmaking, this centennial anniversary timepiece will easily last for another 100 years.

The Journey

When he started designing the watch about 2 years ago, Tõnis Leissoo set out a few firm design principles. The watch had to be related to Estonia, the Estonian War of Independence, and the country’s approaching 100th anniversary. It also had to be made in Estonia. The target market he had in mind were people of Estonian heritage around the world, who remain true patriots of their country and would appreciate a piece of history that they can keep on them at all times. The watch had to remind them of where they came from, and what made their legacy possible. The Wõitleja is not just for those who live in Estonia, but for those whose roots and hearts remain in the tiny North European country. It is also for the many dearly appreciated friends of Estonia, whether they be compassionate statesmen, ambitious and innovative e-residents, or just tourists who found Estonia’s beautiful nature to be a respite for their soul.

The design process started by diving into the history of the beginning – years 1918-1939. Tõnis found many interesting stories about how it was possible for such a small country to win simultaneous wars against Soviet Russia and Germany
column2:
he wanted to see and feel what the people who lived during this period felt. The most inspiring parts were the ones involving Armored Trains, the crucial secret weapons for defeating both enemies. In one of the books, he noticed a picture of an artillery car named Wõitleja, an archaic spelling of the Estonian word for freedom fighter. This word has the special letter Õ, unpronounceable in English, the same letter as in Tõnis’s name. At that moment, the name of the watch was decided.

To hear Tõnis tell the tale:

“I am a 32-year-old IT professional, currently holding a management position in a large multinational corporation. I am also a life-long timepiece enthusiast. I remember liking them since I was six, when I had the opportunity to play with my grandfather’s vintage watches. Even at that age, I knew enough to treat them with great respect.

I have worn a wristwatch ever since, and have gone through numerous different models. My first one was, of course, the classic Casio F91-W. Some years back, I got my first automatic Tag Heuer, which is when the real collecting started. Currently, I own over 20 watches of different makes and styles. My latest acquisition is a Zenith Pilot 20 in bronze.

This Zenith actually served as the greatest inspiration while I was designing my own watch. Before I decided to design a complete timepiece, I created several dial designs on paper and in Photoshop. I modified the watches in my collection – changed their dials, hands, straps, brushed and polished them, and did some movement upgrades.

The design started on paper, and soon moved to 3D thanks to the help of my friends Tago Kalbri and Jürgen Aleksejev. The first version of the watch that was 3D-printed was large, very large. It was made to look like an armored part of a train or a tank. Soon after making the first prototype and showing it to my friends and family, I understood that it is simply too big. I had to pick a smaller size and stick to it. Having a relatively large wrist, I wanted to make it look good on me. The optimal size of the watches I pick for my own collection is 44mm. It is not so small that it will be invisible or illegible, and not too big for wearing all day. The principle of designing a watch that looks large but is comfortable to wear with long sleeves affected the Wõitleja a lot. If you need to make a watch that wears large but is actually not too big, you have only one choice: make the dial as big as possible. To maximize the dial size while sticking to the 44mm limit, I had to give it a very thin bezel. I also wanted the watch to be as thin as possible, no more than 11mm with the caseback. Pretty much all wristwatches have the same layers: crystal, hands, dial, movement, O-ring, and caseback. To minimize thickness, you need to go with either a thin crystal, a thin movement, or a thin caseback.

My first attempt was to go with a thin movement, the ETA2892. This looked weird inside the large-diameter case, and I did not like the look of the third hand. If you are looking for a large-diameter, thin, commonly serviceable movement from Switzerland, there is really only one choice: the Unitas 6497.

With the movement selected, I had to fit it inside the case, along with the O-ring that makes it waterproof. First, I tried a screwdown caseback, but it took up too much space inside the watch, and would have made it thicker. I played around with the design for months, and finally got the idea of moving the screws that keep the watch together to the outside – just like on military equipment gauges. The screws had to be top-down, to complement the masculine, military style. I chose to go with machined titanium 6AL4V hex screws. Hex, not Philips, because this watch is made in 2016: it needs a hint that while it looks vintage, it is actually new.

With all the pieces together, the final design looked so obviously right that I was surprised it took me so long to come up with it. That is the thing about beautiful simplicity – everyone thinks they could have come up with the same solution, but they did not.

The Purchase

The watch is available now, to be built to order with a specially embellished Unitas 6497-2 movement (900€). A leather NATO strap or a matching canvas strap is included. Expected lead time is 2-3 months. The estimated retail price after the campaign is 1200€

All parts of the Estonia1918 Wõitleja watch are finished by hand, so there may be some imperfections, just as there are with hand-crafted jewelry. The patina on each timepiece will also develop differently, depending on the environment in which it is worn, how much it is touched by hands, and many other factors. It will not be even, and it will not be perfect, but that is part of the design of the Wõitleja. Like the country of Estonia, it is not perfect – but for us Estonians, it is the best of its kind in the world.

","IntroductionThe Wõitleja from Estonia1918 is more than just an extraordinary wristwatch: it is a literal time machine, connecting two moments a hundred years apart, and celebrating a tiny nation’s resilience through an exceptionally challenging and turbulent period in history. The brainchild of an enthusiastic young designer, fabricated by an aerospace engineer and finished by an artisan jeweler, the Wõitleja is the Estonian spirit distilled into a physical form. It is a permanent token of the resolve and ingenuity which a century ago helped a tiny nation beat back two invading empires, and today still helps it punch above its weight in freedom and innovation.Limited to a run of no more than a hundred items, the Wõitleja (Estonian for Freedom Fighter) has been selected as part of the official celebrations of the Republic of Estonia’s centennial anniversary. Read More HereThe HistoryAfter eight centuries of continued occupation by foreign powers – first the Crusaders, then various colonial empires – Estonia declared itself an independent nation on February 24th, 1918. It was immediately attacked on two sides, by the Red Army of Soviet Russia, and by the German Empire’s Landeswehr.Within two years, Estonian soldiers had beaten back both enemies, and secured their country’s independence. Estonia’s secret weapons were the Armored Trains – massive rail bound war machines that traveled fast and delivered overwhelming firepower.The name Wõitleja initially belonged to the artillery car of Armored Train Nr. 2, and the watch’s design is directly inspired by the intricate workmanship of bronze gauges found on the heavy military equipment of the First World War era.The Look1918-era locomotives were festooned with bronze gauges, used to tell steam pressure and other vital parameters. These gauges had to be sturdy, but easy to read from a distance, through smoke, in the cab of a train running at full speed. Over time, the metal developed a beautiful patina that gives the items a distinguished masculine appearance. This was the inspiration for the Wõitleja by Estonia1918.The timepiece is designed to be compact and thin, but look large on the wrist. Its case is machined whole from a single block of true old-school CuSn8 brass, a marine-grade alloy of brass and tin that was developed to be submerged in saltwater for a lifetime without corrosion. Exposed to skin and air, it will build up a unique patina that testifies to decades of faithful service.The dial face, adorned by sword-shaped lumed hands and complemented by the brass indexes that form part of the case itself, is hand-crafted and covered in deep black enamel by an artisan jeweler from Roman Tavast, the same person who creates Estonia’s decorations of state – including the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, the highest honor that can be awarded to non-Estonians for outstanding service to the country’s independence.The dial face is covered by sapphire crystal, and sapphire is also used in the waterproof exhibition caseback that both protects and presents the specially embellished Swiss movement. With a 44mm diameter and a height of only 11mm, the thin bezels, enamel dial and machined indexes combine to generate a three-dimensional legibility that enable you to easily tell the time at a glance, from a distance.The watch comes with a selection of military-inspired straps, but will take the owner’s choice of standard 24mm strap, in cloth, leather, or metal that are attached to the watch case with strong screwdown strapbars. Each watch carries a unique serial number between 1 and 100, with number 1 reserved for the watch to be given to the President of Estonia.The Perks1 out of 100 Wõitleja WristwatchEstonian Coat of Arms Pinion for the strap or to be worn separately The Technology The watch designer’s extensive IT experience came in handy in Estonia’s famously tight-knit digital community, known in Silicon Valley as the Estonian Mafia. For the machining of the bronze case and the final assembly of this limited-run centennial timepiece, he drafted in aerospace engineers who spend their days building satellites.The Wõitleja was intended to look as large as possible on the wrist, while maintaining a reasonable physical size. As a military-style watch, it also needed to be practical, which meant serviceable by any competent watchmaker around the world. Despite a broad choice of available movements, only one fit all the criteria: an upgraded variant of the Swiss-made Unitas 6497-2. This more precise and more durable version beats at 3Hz, has 19 jewels instead of the usual 17, and its matte gold plating can be admired through the transparent sapphire caseback. The watch is held together by titanium screws in extruded pods, with hex heads instead of the more classic phillips, to give a subtle clue to future generations that this timepiece was actually made in 2016, not 1918.The dial fabrication process starts by making a die in a CNC machine. The machine engraves the letters “ESTONIA” onto the mold with a precision of 1 micron. Then the die is taken to a press that stamps out the base of the dial, already lettered and curved at the edges. Pure enamel powder (essentially tiny glass particles) that has been washed several times is added to the base of dial, fired at temperatures of over 800 degrees Celsius. At that point, the powder liquefies and fuses to the base of the dial. Once cooled, the process is repeated with the next layer of enamel powder. Altogether, between five and ten coats are applied to produce the desired color and thickness.When the firing is finished, the enamel is polished to a mirror finish. The entire dial creation process is incredibly time-consuming, even for an enameller with over twenty years of experience. Enamel gives the dial an extremely deep black color that will never fade. Since the enamel dials are known as the most durable dial types in the history of watchmaking, this centennial anniversary timepiece will easily last for another 100 years.

column1: The JourneyWhen he started designing the watch about 2 years ago, Tõnis Leissoo set out a few firm design principles. The watch had to be related to Estonia, the Estonian War of Independence, and the country’s approaching 100th anniversary. It also had to be made in Estonia. The target market he had in mind were people of Estonian heritage around the world, who remain true patriots of their country and would appreciate a piece of history that they can keep on them at all times. The watch had to remind them of where they came from, and what made their legacy possible. The Wõitleja is not just for those who live in Estonia, but for those whose roots and hearts remain in the tiny North European country. It is also for the many dearly appreciated friends of Estonia, whether they be compassionate statesmen, ambitious and innovative e-residents, or just tourists who found Estonia’s beautiful nature to be a respite for their soul.The design process started by diving into the history of the beginning – years 1918-1939. Tõnis found many interesting stories about how it was possible for such a small country to win simultaneous wars against Soviet Russia and Germany
column2: he wanted to see and feel what the people who lived during this period felt. The most inspiring parts were the ones involving Armored Trains, the crucial secret weapons for defeating both enemies. In one of the books, he noticed a picture of an artillery car named Wõitleja, an archaic spelling of the Estonian word for freedom fighter. This word has the special letter Õ, unpronounceable in English, the same letter as in Tõnis’s name. At that moment, the name of the watch was decided.To hear Tõnis tell the tale:“I am a 32-year-old IT professional, currently holding a management position in a large multinational corporation. I am also a life-long timepiece enthusiast. I remember liking them since I was six, when I had the opportunity to play with my grandfather’s vintage watches. Even at that age, I knew enough to treat them with great respect.I have worn a wristwatch ever since, and have gone through numerous different models. column2: >Get a FREE MAGiO Cable ($12 Value) by helping us spread the word about Trak Card.  For details check out Update #2.
column5:
>Trak Card is the World's 1st Bluetooth Tracker designed to prevent losing your wallet or phone AND stop RFID credit card scanning. 

Like you, all our lives are in our phones, wallets, and credit cards.  When we lose them, panic sets in
column6:
and in case you haven't heard - RFID scanners can steal your credit card information in seconds.  

Trak Card is more than just the first credit card size Bluetooth tracker with a built-in RFID shield.   It has the unique FIND phone button, and Crowdfind function for locating lost valuables anywhere in the world.

Two way tracking

Both your phone and Trak Card will set off loud alarms to alert you when they are separated.

Find your wallet

One touch FIND on the phone's app (Android or iOS) makes your Trak Card beep - loudly.

And if Trak Card is out of range of your phone (up to 100 feet), the app will show the last known location on Google Map and directions to get there.

If your Trak Card is not there, you can Crowdfind it with thousands of other people. *There are several user groups that we are considering to join for maximum coverage.  It will be decided before the final App versions are released. 

 

Find your phone 

Press the FIND button on Trak Card to make your phone ring- up to 100 feet apart.

Only Trak Card has a RFID Shield

The new credit cards and most ID cards have internal RFID chips which store your personal information. They are easy to hack by thieves walking around with scanners, but Trak Card blocks them. 

So if you don't want to lose your wallet or phone, or have your credit card information stolen, the Trak Card is for you.

It can also be used to track and protect many other valuables:

Why is Trak Card better than other trackers? 

Other trackers can cost up to $30, are thick and bulky (Trak Card is 3 mm), and can easily fall out of wallets.  Trak Card can be opened to replace the battery inside. 

Trak Card is the only card size Bluetooth tracker with the one button FIND phone feature AND RFID shield.  

Trak Card is made of 2 top and bottom PVC layers, and RFID shield with a special cutout for the Bluetooth tracker module.  Most unusual of all - it will be hand assembled in the USA!

Smart tracking app (Android &

column3:

MAGiO Tech is based in New York, with offices in Hong Kong and China.  Our primary business has been contract designing mobile electronics for other companies.  Most of our recent designs are the so called 2-in-1 cables
column4:
one of which was successfully funded here on Indiegogo. 

Timeline

column2:
Challenges

We have completed the Trak Card prototype and successfully tested it for 2 months.  The Bluetooth module is 100% compatible with both Android and iPhone apps.  The hardest part was making it thin and still be able to have a FIND button.

The February 2017 shipping schedule is based upon getting regulatory agency approvals in the US and EU.  Since we will incorporate a Bluetooth module within our custom made case, we don't anticipate any prolonged issues with that.

It's time to revive your eyes.

CRT, Plasma, LCD, and LED screens are everywhere. At the workplace, in your car, on the walls of your home, in the palm of your hand and soon your VR headset. Whether we realize it or not, continual exposure to screens can not only keep us awake at night, it can cause digital eye strain: blurry vision, dry eyes, and overall fatigue. Heated Eye Pad allows you to soothe digital eye strain, and preserve the health of your eyes.

 

The Heated Eye Pad is an FDA-Approved Device

The Heated Eye Pad is the first in the warm compress market to introduce highly affordable, electronically accurate temperature precision. Just 10 minutes a day can change how your eyes feel for the better.

 

 

Key Highlights of Our Device
column3:

A Doctor's Opinion
column5:
showinfo=0"">

Dr. Krywko explains how the Heated Eye Pad can treat dry, tired eyes in the long term, along with other eye conditions such as stye, blepharitis, and chalazia.

column1: Thermal images showing the specific eyelid area that is heated during treatment. The skin warms to a comfortable, constant, optimal temperature. Just ten minutes a day will yield long term benefits!

The Heated Eye Pad is for everyone: computer users, frequent travelers, contact wearers, and all ages of adults. Avoid and prevent digital eye strain by taking care of your eyes with our simple wearable!

The Heated Eye Pad is as simple as a pair of glasses. After plugging it in (with its USB cord/power supply), the warming elements on the device heat up immediately. Just close your eyes and put it on, making sure that the golden eyelid warming elements are positioned over your upper eyelids.
While wearing your device, it's best to sit or lay down. Get comfy! Listen to music or a podcast during your 10-15 minutes a day.

Digital eye strain, dry eye, or other irritating eye conditions develop due to many of the same reasons. Your eyelid contains glands with oils that help your eyes produce tears, moisturize, and maintain overall eye health. Due to stress, aging, eye strain, and other factors, these oils can get trapped in the glands of your eyes. The Heated Eye Pad releases these oils, ultimately relieving you of dry, tired eyes!

John got the idea for the Heated Eye Pad after struggling with dry eye problems for years. Living in a desert environment and spending way too much time in front of a computer only made his eye problems worse. Physicians all advised the use of a warm compress, but it just wasn’t good enough – warm compresses that were available on the market couldn’t sustain a constant temperature, and they were always a mess and a lot of hassle to warm up. John was sick of heating up wet rags and buying multiple disposable compresses.

Eventually, John developed a chalazion on his eye that became so enflamed, it needed to be surgically excised. The problem now? The excision was incomplete and his eye problems were even further exacerbated. His doctor tried injecting a steroid into his eyelid, but when that failed to dissolve, he passed John’s case over to an in-house plastic surgeon. The surgeon’s procedure on John’s eye became infected and now an even more aggressive surgery needed to be performed to clean everything up. These procedures left John with a divot in his eyelid, multiple destroyed meibomian glands, and heavy scar tissue around his eye.

What advice did John’s doctors give him now that he had so many physical issues with his eyes? Simple – they still recommended a warm compress. The answer was ALWAYS a warm compress, but John knew there had to be a better way to deliver the treatment. And so, the Heated Eye Pad was born. John was desperate for a real long-term solution to keep up with preventative treatment for his eyes so he invented the first and only no-mess digitally heated eye compress – the Heated Eye Pad. The best part? It didn’t just help John avoid dry eye and chalazion recurrence. Instead, the Heated Eye Pad had a use for EVERYONE who sought out healthy, refreshed eyes.
Every Heated Eye Pad comes with a Satisfaction Guarantee or your money back and a 1 Year Warranty.

Quality production is a huge part of what we focus on, so here are a few photos of our plastics shop! We launched this campaign, not only because we want to share our product with the world, but to cover costs as we scale production. Check out the cool process:
Our product is made in the USA. We're based in Tempe, Arizona, and we're all about family. Here are a few pictures of us!
In the prototyping phase: son, Nicholas, assembling some Heated Eye Pad devices at home.
Daughters Sachi and Suzi hang out with Mom and Dr. Misha Faustina's mother, Pat, while Dad and Dr. Faustina are hard at work with product trials.
Graphic designer Hailey showing John a few snapchat filters!
John and his family after a day hike with the pup. Thank you all for your support!

","It's time to revive your eyes.CRT, Plasma, LCD, and LED screens are everywhere. At the workplace, in your car, on the walls of your home, in the palm of your hand and soon your VR headset. Whether we realize it or not, continual exposure to screens can not only keep us awake at night, it can cause digital eye strain: blurry vision, dry eyes, and overall fatigue. Heated Eye Pad allows you to soothe digital eye strain, and preserve the health of your eyes. The Heated Eye Pad is an FDA-Approved DeviceThe Heated Eye Pad is the first in the warm compress market to introduce highly affordable, electronically accurate temperature precision. Just 10 minutes a day can change how your eyes feel for the better.  Key Highlights of Our Device  Featured In: A Doctor's OpinionDr. Krywko explains how the Heated Eye Pad can treat dry, tired eyes in the long term, along with other eye conditions such as stye, blepharitis, and chalazia. Users Sharing
I tried it that day, in the office... it made a huge difference in just minutes.""
Within five or ten minutes of having the Heated Eye Pad on, my eyes feel a whole lot better.""
More testimonials on our website and our youtube page!
Hundreds of Doctors Believe in Us!
Click the map to go to Google and see all the doctors who support our product! We've sold around the US, as well as worldwide.
