column1: MODUCO (MODern Urban COmpany) is the collaborative vision of two good friends and former roommates
column2: one an American watch designer, the other a Swiss watch brand &amp
column3: product manager with a combined experience of more than 10 years in the watch industry.

column1: We have set out to design a watch inspired by the urban environment, modern aesthetics and industrial elements that finely juxtaposes boldness with simplicity and rawness with sophistication.

The concept of the MODUCO timepiece was originally conceived during our time in Miami Florida as roommates and co-workers. What started us on our journey was our passion for watch design which initially landed us both at a company in the fashion watch industry
column2: an industry full of possibilities, but ultimately over saturated with monotonous designs seen many times over. Our dream was to utilize our combined experience of over 10 years in the watch industry and create something of our own, something meaningful, powerful and unique.

column1: Since our days in South Florida and our initial concept phase, we have separated
column2: one left for New York and continued design operations, while the other went back to his home country of Switzerland to begin generating relationships with manufactures and to lead the development process.

column1: • One is an American who currently lives in New York. The other is a Swiss who is now based in Neuchâtel, Switzerland.
• Worked for watch companies in Switzerland, U.S. and Hong-Kong.
• Designed and developed watches from $50 up to $100,000.
• Accomplished in creating new watch collections (from concept to final product) for well known fashion and luxury brands.
Our case is defined by the interplay of several elements derived from our inspiration:
This criteria coupled with meticulous execution of contrasting details creates a look that is powerful, yet sophisticated and uncluttered.

MODUCO's most eye catching and unique feature is its distinct cylindrical bezel and case back that erupts through the case body and draws inspiration from raw industrial piping. It is finely balanced with a combination of traditional finishing techniques interpreted in fresh new ways.

The top of the bezel is diagonally brushed which adds interest and assists in creating depth and a sense of perspective. This is contrasted with heavy vertical brushing on the bezel side. These two planes are broken by a highly polished chamfer that beautifully captures and reflects light.
The case body is sculpted with clean architectural lines and completed with a subtle sandblast finish to contrast the industrial rawness of the cylinder bezel.

The crown plays in harmony with the bezel and displays heavy vertical brushing on the side of the cylinder and the top which is separated by a notched chamfer to provide a firm grip for setting the watch.

UPDATE: All backers can upgrade to the ""Lume dial"" for $25.
This new dial features a black matte upper-layer, Tritec C1 Super-Luminova lower-layer and XII ceramic applied with C1 Tritec Super-Luminova powder.
Dimension drives the design, from the striking cylinder bezel to the sandwich construction dial consisting of a matte top dial with cut-out hour indexes that exposes the sunray lacquered dial below.
This dimensional push/pull effect is completed by the heavy vertical brushed Roman numeral XII ascending from the surface of the dial like a city skyline.
Our modern heavy brushed skeleton hands add to the dimensional effect created by the sandwich dial and high rise index and will utilize Tritec Luminova C1 for easy visibility in low light.
We will be offering two Swiss Made movements (both quartz and automatic) to power our unique case style.
UPDATE: Free movement upgrade for all backers

For the automatic we will be partnering with Sellita, a successful leader in the watch industry, and utilizing their SW200 movement with 26 jewels, a calendar at the 3 o'clock position and a 38 hour running time. We chose the élaboré grade with incabloc shock absorber.
(Prototype Only - The final movement will feature a custom engraved rotor with the brand name)
The automatic version will boast a heavy diagonal brushed, screw down exhibition case back with acid etched markings.
We have chosen to team with Ronda for our quartz edition, a company with over 70 years of watch making experience, and will be employing their very reliable and precise 513 caliber.
The quartz edition case back will feature a heavy diagonal brushed, screw down case back with acid etched logo and markings.
The modern lifestyle offers a variety of opportunities and interactions, from work to play, each day.

Each watch purchased will come with a 100% vegetable tanned Italian calf leather strap that is pre-selected for each coloration, but you will also be allowed to choose an additional strap option of either a Nato strap or stainless steel mesh bracelet (additional $20).
All straps will come with easy quick release pin levers for easy changeability, so you may further customize your watch to suit your mood and occasion .
(Add $20 to your contribution and swap one of the straps for a premium quality 316L stainless steel mesh band with brushed finishing and quick release spring bar)
You can now also choose from the textile cordura straps (at no extra cost). Add a technical look to your selection by choosing the black or green cordura. Both of them come with leather lining.

Holding true to our desire to create every detail with purpose, the MODUCO 305 watch will be delivered in a book-closure style luxury box that is slim, easy to store and even travel with, so that your watch will always be protected when not worn.
• soft touch lamination paper for the cover
• silver vertical brushed paper around the inner carton
• spot UV gloss treated logo with diagonal brushing effect, reminiscent of the bezel top
• and high density premium protective foam with cutouts for the watch, additional strap and warranty card for ultimate protection.

MODUCO prides itself on quality and the execution of fine details. Bringing you a uniquely crafted 'Swiss Made' watch at an affordable price point that cuts out the middleman and additional markups is our goal.

Our watches are designed in the USA and will be developed and hand assembled in the region of La Chaux-de-Fonds, Jura, Bienne and Solothurn in Switzerland with some of the finest partners in the industry.
By supporting our campaign, you will be given the option to chose from our pre-designed collection.
Our Sellita SW200 automatic edition (305A) will be offered at a limited quantity of 305 pieces, while our quartz (305Q) will be offered at an unlimited quantity.
After completion of the campaign, each backer will be sent an order form via email. You will receive one order form for each purchase made to choose your:
This form must be returned to us to place your order and begin manufacturing on a timely schedule.
At this time, please only select how many watches you would like with the movement you desire by choosing the corresponding reward above at the top right of the page.
Follow us on Instagram and Facebook to stay up to date with all the happenings at MODUCO!
For any questions, please contact us at:
We would like to take a brief second to thank those who have supported us throughout this long journey. 3 years in the making, MODUCO is now a reality.
We would first like to thank our family and close friends, for most things in life start with you.
We would also like to thank all the Instagram bloggers, influencers and media outlets for the fantastic posts and photography and for helping us get the word out about MODUCO, most notibly:

Lastly, and most importantly, we would like to thank all of you who purchased and backed our unique labor of love. Please enjoy your timepiece, keep supporting the modern/urban lifestyle and make the world an awesome place.
We have just completed a successful Kickstarter campaign in which we met our goal by 120% allowing us to initiate our first orders.
Our Indemand project here on Indiegogo is structured to allow more people to preorder our unique watch case and to continue growing our business.
With each purchase you will receive the case style of your choice, 1 leather strap and your choice of an additional strap.
Stainless steel mesh bracelets are available for $20 extra.

We understand that creating and delivering a new product may come with unexpected delays or setbacks. With our 10 years of combined experience in the watch industry and with one of our co-founders stationed in Switzerland who has built strong relationships with some of the top Swiss manufacturers, we feel confident that we have greatly minimized these risks.

We have spent 3 years meticulously crafting this timepiece down to the finest detail and with tried and tested prototypes gaining excellent reviews from bloggers and influencers abroad, we are confident in its quality.

It is our goal to be completely transparent with our backers, keeping them informed every step along the journey of manufacturing.  We will be providing photos and videos of this process from manufacturing to delivery.

If along the way, we find that there is a setback in production, or a delay somewhere during the process in the timeline, we will be transparent and keep all of our backers informed. If our campaign is successful, we are targeting a shipping window in mid to late August.

We desire to provide our backer with the best customer service and encourage our backers to feel comfortable to reach out to us at any moment to ask questions and we pledge to get back to you within 24 hours.
We are always grateful to those who spread the word of our brand with those who may be interested in a quality and affordable Swiss Made watch.
Also, we encourage you to use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out.
","2 years international warranty / Free worldwide shipping / 30 days return

Sugar Patrol Clothing is on a mission to inspire others to create change.  Let's transform dreams into reality.  We promote perseverance, fortitude, wellness, education, and love!
In 2003, I was 100lbs over weight, struggling with my career, and living alone
column2: I needed to change, so I moved back to my home town on the beach.  I bought an old ski boat to become more active.  It represented a new beginning for me.  I was looking for my passion and purpose
column3: I was looking for my sugar!  My best friend and I decided to name the boat Sugar Patrol!  We thought, ""we should create T-shirts that say Sugar Patrol to wear on the boat.""  The idea was born.

column2: I imagined there were four women from different eras who had owned the boat before me. Each had the same dreams, desires, and struggles.  They were all just looking for their sugar! So, now I am telling their stories to encourage others! https://www.facebook.com/sugarpatrolclothing/

column1: To create the art for the T-shirts, I enlisted the help of designer and amazing artist, Melissa Taylor http://katastrophicclothing.com/about/  It took us 8 months to get the ladies just right.  Melissa worked tirelessly to capture my exact ideas using her flare.  The results were beautiful.  The Ladies of Sugar Patrol want to share their stories to motivate others. Through them, I want to fund and fuel women to create solutions that matter.

The vision for Sugar Patrol’s future is to inspire more women by representing other cultures and their style influences.  If we fund more than the $20,000 needed, we can start on the next four Sugar Patrol Ladies.  Welcome Aboard! Be a part of the Sugar Patrol!

I decided that each Sugar Patrol Lady should have their own line of clothing inspired by their era and unique body style.  I started small with just T shirts.  We are nearing the final prototype.  We have posted pictures of the models wearing the shirts.  They are not quite the finished product, but for the most part they will be what you receive.  (SHIRT SIZES COME IN XS, S, M, XL)
I have bootstrapped all of the funds and have worked extra jobs to get to this point, but now I need your help to share the Sugar Patrol Ladies with everyone!

It will take $20,000 to create prototypes that are production ready to launch Spring 2017.   The launch would include four different styles, representing each SP Lady, of  beach bags, shorts, and bathing suits(as seen in the art on the T-shirts).  The idea is to launch with everything you would need to go to the beach!

The funds will go to all pre-production costs such as pattern making, grading, design consultation, fabric, samples, website creation, graphic design for social media and website, handling/shipping, advertising costs, rewards for the crowd fund, photography, and video production.

T-shirt revisions and grading will cost just under $1000.  We also have other T-shirt designs that can be placed on the shirts that I would like to launch,  There would be 3-4 per style.  The prototypes for the beach bags, suits, and shorts will cost just under $12,000.  graphic design/social media content is $1600 for 8 mo to get us through the launch in the spring, $1150 for website development/design, $2800 for a photoshoot to include the new prototypes, $1600 for attorney's fees/licensing.  Any additional funds will go toward production, advertising, and development of the next 4 SP ladies.
• At the $75 level, you will receive a shirt of your choice.
• At the $150 level, you will also receive a beach bag.

• At $250 and beyond, you will receive a shirt, beach bag, plus other merchandise and more, including a collector's item numbered shirt with the signature of the SP lady you choose, and a ticket to our first fashion show!
• If for some reason we cannot fund the other prototypes, additional shirts will be given in place of those items.  I will work with backers to make sure they get what they want.
• You will get the perk that matches the TOTAL amount you donated.  So if you can only donate a little at a time, that is just FINE!

column2: >TO THE MEN WHO LOVE THE LADIES OF SUGAR PATROL

column1: We love our male supporters, please feel free to select any of the perks! One thought is that you can use them for gifts for the special women in your life

However, if you want to be in on the inner circle of our men's line, take a look at the Crew Package.  I have put together something to honor our men who support and love us! For $225 you can receive 4 pieces of merchandise and have voting rights on what will make our men's line. You will also be invited to our first fashion show and will have photos taken with the ladies.  If you select the $500 or $1000 option, I will let you customize your items to include merchandise from the ""Crew Package"".
ANYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES TO THE CAMPAIGN will get to vote on the projects that are submitted to receive the 10% of the surplus for start up funds.  Support us today!

column3: >If we fund at least $4500, Sugar Patrol can move forward.  We will launch with T-shirts !

column2: >Let's fund it all and more today!  Remember, a percentage of the surplus will be given to two lucky ladies to get started on their idea!
>Another 10% of the surplus will go to Alpha Xi Delta and their efforts to support Autism

column1: Your contribution will change the course of my life and the lives of many others.  The more you give, the more people we can help.  In the future, Sugar Patrol Clothing is seeking to start a foundation or incubator of sorts to help women fund and find the resources to make their ideas, passions, and solutions a reality.  It will be a way to connect women to others who have paved the way or who can support them in some way.  This is my company's mission.  Please help us get started!

I have already invested my personal money in this project.  I have worked multiple jobs, taken all of my savings, and skimmed any and all extra income from my salary to fund up to this point.  It  is important to me to build something that can also help others.  It is my fresh start, and I want it to be a new beginning for many other women.

It has taken three years to get to this stage.  I have started and stopped many times due to a lack of funds, but I have persevered.    I have never doubted that this day would come.  Any new business venture is a risk, but I have proven that I have the tools to keep pushing forward no matter the road block. It is very important to me to help other women, especially those wanting a new start.  Help us do that today!

INVESTING IN OTHERS is always risky, but I believe the pay off is too great not to take the risk.  In the words of Frost, ""and I—I took the one less traveled by,  And that has made all the difference.""

column2: >If you can't contribute, you can still help!

column1: Help us by following on Facebook, Instagram and Pinterest.  Post links on your social media pages, and use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!  You can be a part of the Sugar Patrol difference just by sharing our campaign!
Sugar Patrol Clothing is on a mission to inspire others to create change.  Let's transform dreams into reality.  We promote perseverance, fortitude, wellness, education, and love!
In 2003, I was 100lbs over weight, struggling with my career, and living alone
column2: I needed to change, so I moved back to my home town on the beach.  I bought an old ski boat to become more active.  It represented a new beginning for me.  I was looking for my passion and purpose
column3: I was looking for my sugar!  My best friend and I decided to name the boat Sugar Patrol!  We thought, ""we should create T-shirts that say Sugar Patrol to wear on the boat.""  The idea was born.

column1: As time passed, the idea evolved
column2: I imagined there were four women from different eras who had owned the boat before me. Each had the same dreams, desires, and struggles.  They were all just looking for their sugar! So, now I am telling their stories to encourage others! https://www.facebook.com/sugarpatrolclothing/

column1: To create the art for the T-shirts, I enlisted the help of designer and amazing artist, Melissa Taylor http://katastrophicclothing.com/about/  It took us 8 months to get the ladies just right.  Melissa worked tirelessly to capture my exact ideas using her flare.  The results were beautiful.  The Ladies of Sugar Patrol want to share their stories to motivate others. Through them, I want to fund and fuel women to create solutions that matter.

The vision for Sugar Patrol’s future is to inspire more women by representing other cultures and their style influences.  If we fund more than the $20,000 needed, we can start on the next four Sugar Patrol Ladies.  Welcome Aboard! Be a part of the Sugar Patrol!

I decided that each Sugar Patrol Lady should have their own line of clothing inspired by their era and unique body style.  I started small with just T shirts.  We are nearing the final prototype.  We have posted pictures of the models wearing the shirts.  They are not quite the finished product, but for the most part they will be what you receive.  (SHIRT SIZES COME IN XS, S, M, XL)
What We Need & What You Get
I have bootstrapped all of the funds and have worked extra jobs to get to this point, but now I need your help to share the Sugar Patrol Ladies with everyone!

It will take $20,000 to create prototypes that are production ready to launch Spring 2017.   The launch would include four different styles, representing each SP Lady, of  beach bags, shorts, and bathing suits(as seen in the art on the T-shirts).  The idea is to launch with everything you would need to go to the beach!
HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE UTILIZED

The funds will go to all pre-production costs such as pattern making, grading, design consultation, fabric, samples, website creation, graphic design for social media and website, handling/shipping, advertising costs, rewards for the crowd fund, photography, and video production.

T-shirt revisions and grading will cost just under $1000.  We also have other T-shirt designs that can be placed on the shirts that I would like to launch,  There would be 3-4 per style.  The prototypes for the beach bags, suits, and shorts will cost just under $12,000.  graphic design/social media content is $1600 for 8 mo to get us through the launch in the spring, $1150 for website development/design, $2800 for a photoshoot to include the new prototypes, $1600 for attorney's fees/licensing.  Any additional funds will go toward production, advertising, and development of the next 4 SP ladies.
At the $75 level, you will receive a shirt of your choice.
At the $150 level, you will also receive a beach bag.

At $250 and beyond, you will receive a shirt, beach bag, plus other merchandise and more, including a collector's item numbered shirt with the signature of the SP lady you choose, and a ticket to our first fashion show!
If for some reason we cannot fund the other prototypes, additional shirts will be given in place of those items.  I will work with backers to make sure they get what they want.
You will get the perk that matches the TOTAL amount you donated.  So if you can only donate a little at a time, that is just FINE!
TO THE MEN WHO LOVE THE LADIES OF SUGAR PATROL
We love our male supporters, please feel free to select any of the perks! One thought is that you can use them for gifts for the special women in your life

However, if you want to be in on the inner circle of our men's line, take a look at the Crew Package.  I have put together something to honor our men who support and love us! For $225 you can receive 4 pieces of merchandise and have voting rights on what will make our men's line. You will also be invited to our first fashion show and will have photos taken with the ladies.  If you select the $500 or $1000 option, I will let you customize your items to include merchandise from the ""Crew Package"".
See the details of our perks!
ANYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES TO THE CAMPAIGN will get to vote on the projects that are submitted to receive the 10% of the surplus for start up funds.  Support us today!
If we fund at least $4500, Sugar Patrol can move forward.  We will launch with T-shirts !
Let's fund it all and more today!  Remember, a percentage of the surplus will be given to two lucky ladies to get started on their idea!
MY SISTERS OF ALPHA XI DELTA
Another 10% of the surplus will go to Alpha Xi Delta and their efforts to support Autism Speaks.

Your contribution will change the course of my life and the lives of many others.  The more you give, the more people we can help.  In the future, Sugar Patrol Clothing is seeking to start a foundation or incubator of sorts to help women fund and find the resources to make their ideas, passions, and solutions a reality.  It will be a way to connect women to others who have paved the way or who can support them in some way.  This is my company's mission.  Please help us get started!

I have already invested my personal money in this project.  I have worked multiple jobs, taken all of my savings, and skimmed any and all extra income from my salary to fund up to this point.  It  is important to me to build something that can also help others.  It is my fresh start, and I want it to be a new beginning for many other women.

It has taken three years to get to this stage.  I have started and stopped many times due to a lack of funds, but I have persevered.    I have never doubted that this day would come.  Any new business venture is a risk, but I have proven that I have the tools to keep pushing forward no matter the road block. It is very important to me to help other women, especially those wanting a new start.  Help us do that today!

INVESTING IN OTHERS is always risky, but I believe the pay off is too great not to take the risk.  In the words of Frost, ""and I—I took the one less traveled by,  And that has made all the difference.""
If you can't contribute, you can still help!

Help us by following on Facebook, Instagram and Pinterest.  Post links on your social media pages, and use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!  You can be a part of the Sugar Patrol difference just by sharing our campaign!",11.0,8,"1 Campaign

column5: >Using sustainably sourced wood pulp as the material for our frames gives TURTL's these key advantages.
column9: >These revolutionary frames also offer the most striking colors and styles.
column11: >These next-generation polarized lenses enhance your vision with optimal optical clarity, protect your eyes from 100% of UV rays, and have an anti-scratch coating.
column12: >TURTL sunglasses feature the world's first polarized lenses made from plants!
column14: >These next-gen polarized lenses are made from ethically sourced castor plants and offer flawless optical clarity as well as and an anti-scratch coating.
column16: >TURTL's ""True-Fit"" nose-pads, make it feel like you're not even wearing sunglasses, and offer all-day comfort for all faces.
column18: >... and they look good on everybody!
column19: >

column34: >Scroll down for size charts and more info on the styles and colors.
column35: >TURTL sunglasses are also better for our planet, by replacing traditional toxic plastic sunglass materials with advanced plant-based, biodegradable materials.
column36: >We’ve done this to help shift an industry that creates over 100M+ pounds of plastic waste per year.
column38: >To further our impact, we've committed to recycling 100 water bottles worth of plastic from our oceans for every pair sold. We've already pledged to recycle over 24,000 water bottles worth of plastic in just a few days!
column42: >You can feel great, knowing your purchase is helping alleviate our massive global plastic problem.
column48: >At TURTL, we pride ourselves on creating long-lasting sunglasses. Each pair comes with a 1-year warranty.
column49: >If there’s anything wrong with your sunglasses outside of usual wear and tear, just send them back to us and we’ll repair or replace them free of charge. Rest easy knowing you’re covered.
column60: >To ensure the finest quality, every pair of TURTL sunglasses are handcrafted and inspected in a 3rd generation family-run factory, nestled in the Italian Alps.
column68: >We're committed to being planet-first. All TURTL packaging is made from 100% recycled materials.
column73: >After a year of research and design, it was time for us to travel to Italy to meet with 15 of the world's top eyewear experts. See our recap in the video:
column80: >We call it ""The Trifecta"". Sunglasses that are good for the planet, your style and your wallet.
column87: >With revolutionary plant-based materials and a direct-to-consumer business model, we're able to bring you everything you love about premium eyewear, but without the pollution or inflated prices.
column92: >Focusing on the needs of our planet, it’s vital we reinvent the eyewear industry, which is largely run by one monopoly, and is both polluting and overpriced.
column93: >For example, a study by Forbes shows that brands that retail for upwards of $400 cost roughly $25 to produce, that’s nearly a 1600% markup.
column98: >Every pair of TURTL sunglasses is handcrafted by artisans in Italy. Each pair is inspected for any flaws to the finest degree.
column100: >Our structural rivets are carefully inserted by the hands of experts, so they're the most durable and dependable they can possibly be.
column101: >Over the past 18 months, we’ve collaborated with the world's leading eyewear experts to bring you truly something special, using only the highest quality materials.
column105: >The end result... a product that is 100% made in the EU. Our BioNylon lenses are created in France by the world-renowned Dalloz Creation, our 3-barrel hinges are sourced from Austria and the final, handcrafted sunglasses are perfected in Cadore, Italy.
column110: >Your support in making this dream is truly important to us. We wanted to do something to help make your TURTL sunglasses important to you as well.

","Using advanced bioplastic technology, TURTL's BioShell frames are stronger, lighter weight, and longer-lasting than traditional sunglasses.   Using sustainably sourced wood pulp as the material for our frames gives TURTL's these key advantages.  These revolutionary frames also offer the most striking colors and styles. These next-generation polarized lenses enhance your vision with optimal optical clarity, protect your eyes from 100% of UV rays, and have an anti-scratch coating.TURTL sunglasses feature the world's first polarized lenses made from plants!  These next-gen polarized lenses are made from ethically sourced castor plants and offer flawless optical clarity as well as and an anti-scratch coating.TURTL's ""True-Fit"" nose-pads, make it feel like you're not even wearing sunglasses, and offer all-day comfort for all faces.  ... and they look good on everybody!  Each style comes in 3 colors:    Scroll down for size charts and more info on the styles and colors.TURTL sunglasses are also better for our planet, by replacing traditional toxic plastic sunglass materials with advanced plant-based, biodegradable materials.We’ve done this to help shift an industry that creates over 100M+ pounds of plastic waste per year.To further our impact, we've committed to recycling 100 water bottles worth of plastic from our oceans for every pair sold. We've already pledged to recycle over 24,000 water bottles worth of plastic in just a few days!  You can feel great, knowing your purchase is helping alleviate our massive global plastic problem.  At TURTL, we pride ourselves on creating long-lasting sunglasses. Each pair comes with a 1-year warranty.If there’s anything wrong with your sunglasses outside of usual wear and tear, just send them back to us and we’ll repair or replace them free of charge. Rest easy knowing you’re covered.     To ensure the finest quality, every pair of TURTL sunglasses are handcrafted and inspected in a 3rd generation family-run factory, nestled in the Italian Alps.    We're committed to being planet-first. All TURTL packaging is made from 100% recycled materials.   After a year of research and design, it was time for us to travel to Italy to meet with 15 of the world's top eyewear experts. See our recap in the video:  We call it ""The Trifecta"". Sunglasses that are good for the planet, your style and your wallet.   With revolutionary plant-based materials and a direct-to-consumer business model, we're able to bring you everything you love about premium eyewear, but without the pollution or inflated prices.  Focusing on the needs of our planet, it’s vital we reinvent the eyewear industry, which is largely run by one monopoly, and is both polluting and overpriced.For example, a study by Forbes shows that brands that retail for upwards of $400 cost roughly $25 to produce, that’s nearly a 1600% markup.  Every pair of TURTL sunglasses is handcrafted by artisans in Italy. Each pair is inspected for any flaws to the finest degree.Our structural rivets are carefully inserted by the hands of experts, so they're the most durable and dependable they can possibly be.Over the past 18 months, we’ve collaborated with the world's leading eyewear experts to bring you truly something special, using only the highest quality materials.  The end result... a product that is 100% made in the EU. Our BioNylon lenses are created in France by the world-renowned Dalloz Creation, our 3-barrel hinges are sourced from Austria and the final, handcrafted sunglasses are perfected in Cadore, Italy.  Your support in making this dream is truly important to us. We wanted to do something to help make your TURTL sunglasses important to you as well.",64.0,2,"1 Campaign

SCOOTS | The World's First Plant-Based Footwear Brand
column4:
>

 

Introducing our product, the PA1 (Pine-apple 1). 

We've spent the past 18 months crafting the perfect shoe that is comfortable, versatile, and environmentally impactful. Our shoes will keep you comfy from your morning commute to happy hour drinks, look as good with your date-night outfit as they do with your comfy sweats, and will last longer than Nicolas Cage's acting career. And dammit, they look cool. 

We love the PA1 because they are...
column10:
> 

We keep telling you that we made a plant shoe, but what does that mean, exactly?
column11:
> 

 If you're nerdy like us and want to know more, here are all the details on each material.
column12:
>

 

Our latex and cotton insole provides all day support and comfort! See for yourself:
column16:
> 

Take a look at how our shoes are made. Spoiler alert: it's not a bunch of magic elves, and it doesn't happen at the North Pole.

column6:
>

 

We have an amazing team of craftsmen and -women working with us in Portugal. 

Why Portugal?

column1: Cork is a key ingredient in our shoe and over 45% of the world's cork is grown in Southern Portugal. The best know-how on working with cork is also there.
• There is a long heritage of making high-quality footwear in and around Porto, where there are over 300 shoe factories.
• We can be certain that everyone who works on a pair of Scoots is treated fairly and is paid a living wage. Dave spent a whole month in our factories to make sure.
• Portugal is strategically located right on the water, which allows us to easily ship our shoes to just about anywhere in the world. We also wouldn't mind some beach vacations.

column4:
> 

It's important to us to leave as small of an environmental footprint as possible. We accomplish this not only by responsibly sourcing our materials, but also by properly disposing of our shoes once you are done wearing them.
column8:
>

We believe that we need to both minimize our negative effects and maximize our positive contributions to the environment. So in addition to our shoe disposal program, we also plant a tree for every pair of Scoots purchased. 

With your help, we can make a difference: our goal is to plant 20,000 trees. Thanks to our email subscribers and Kickstarter customers we are well on our way already! Your support for Scoots can take us over the finish line!

We partnered with Forest Nation to make this program possible and they have chosen Tanzania as a place where these trees can have the greatest impact. Check out one of their past projects, the transformation of the Kwembago Forest, below.
column11:
>

We will collect your size information via a survey after you place your order. Our sizing is very similar to a VANS slip on.
column14:
>

You'll be receiving your Scoots in early October. Here's what will happen from now to then:
column23:
>

Our team is a diverse crew that brings a wealth of experience from a variety of industries to bring this company to life. These are just a few of the places where we have worked, and we are all incredibly proud to be part of the Scoots team now.
column27:
>

Risks and challenges

Our partners bring over three decades of experience in the footwear business and we have spent time building a strong enduring relationship with them. To date we have spent over a month at their facility and will be spending the entire month of July there as well to ensure the project stays on track.

We are very confident that we can deliver your Scoots on time and have worked closely with our partners to lay out the timeline. Of course, unforeseen circumstances can cause delays, but we will always strive to be as transparent as possible by updating you every two weeks on our progress!

 

Environmental commitments

Reusability and recyclability

Our shoe disposal program offers customers the option to return their shoes to us when finished wearing them for a proper disposal. The steps are:

1) Love and wear your Scoots for a long time. 
2) Mail them back to us when you're finished wearing them. 
3) We separate the shoe into components and compost 80% of it. 
4) We responsibly dispose of the other 20%.

Sustainable materials

Scoots' PA1s are made from 95%+ plant-based materials, including pineapples, cork, corn, natural latex, and cotton. This unique combination of materials allows our shoes to wear out slow while breaking down fast.

0,"


 

 You'll get not just one, but TWO high quality Seiko powered Chronograph watches, a unique military crate watch box, a limited edition serial numbered dog tag and 2 extra watch straps.

 


 

Perhaps the major highlight, and what we’re most proud to announce, is our plans for the future of the MS1 Military Watch Set. Once we're fully funded, we're planning on keeping the production running so that we can sell the MS1 Military Watch Set in participating retail stores and through our website.

A 20% of the net proceeds from the sales of this watch set will be donated to help various veterans causes - mainly to aid wounded military veterans as well as those suffering from PTSD. Some of the organizations we'll work with do great work like suicide prevention, providing supplemental health care as well as career counseling. We also have some ideas on how to get our backer community involved. This is a worthy cause that deserves more attention and we’re proud to do our small part.  


 

With its simple lines, clean dials and vintage looks, the MS1 was designed and developed over a period of 8 months. What you see now is the final result of many experiments with movements and components to bring you a refined, high quality watch at a price that can't be refused. 

 

  • You get both watches as part of the set:

 

The MS1 was built to be the following:
Tough - Built solid, with high quality materials to get you through all the messy situations.
Reliable - With a trusted movement that can be powered for 3 years on one battery.
Minimal - A vintage look and feel inspired by mission critical military aircraft instruments.
Functional - An easy-to-view date function and chronograph seamlessly integrated into the design.
Value - Get a lot for a little. Having no middlemen allows us to build you premium timepieces for a minimal cost.

To ensure a sturdy build, we had to use stainless steel to forge the MS1 casing. With a thin bezel around the watch, we thought a 42mm diameter case (measured w/o the crown) would be the perfect size for any wrist. It's not oversized if you have a smaller wrist, and it's definitely not too small if your wrist is larger. With a total height of 10MM and a weight of 59 grams (with a nylon strap), it feels good on the wrist. 

Protecting the face of the watch, you'll find scratch resistant sapphire glass. Coupled with the stainless steel case and backing, the combination gives this watch a water resistance of 5ATM which will be fine under water during showers and swims.
 


 

Powering the MS1 Watch Collection is the Seiko (TMI) VD51 Japanese quartz movement. It has a minute, hour and second hand, as well as a date function at the 3PM location. The date window has been carefully cut to ensure it can be read easily - no need to squint as you check to see what day it is. 

An added bonus to the Seiko VD51 is the chronograph function which has two dials to measure seconds and minutes. These are activated and reset by two pushers located on opposite sides of the crown. The movement can be powered up to 3 years on one battery (Sony battery included).
 

 

To complete the vintage military look on the MS1, we added a NATO style strap. These 22MM wide straps are made out of ballistic nylon, have stainless steel hardware and can be removed with little effort - no tools required. The MS1 Watch Set comes with 2 additional NATO straps and 2 additional ZULU style straps to give you a nice combination of colors / looks.
 

All straps in the following pictures are included in the watch set:

 

See just how easy it is to switch straps:

We carried the military theme right over to our packaging with a rustic wooden military crate. Inside each crate, two MS1 watches will sit, nestled on a burlap pillow. That’s right - each package will contain two watches - in two different color finishes with interchangeable NATO straps. So whether combat ready, in dress blues or civies, the MS1 allows you to style your timepiece according to your wardrobe.

Each MS1 Military Watch Set comes with a special embossed dog tag. This dog tag has a serial number that is unique to each watch set, it indicates the production run/series, the production year and the watch number.
Each MS1 Watch Set includes the following:
• MS1 Chronograph Watch in black/black with black NATO watch strap
• MS1 Chronograph Watch in silver/white with army green NATO watch strap
• Military dog tag with unique serial number
• Extra red/white/blue striped NATO watch strap (""The Patriot)
• Extra black/grey striped NATO watch strap (""The Secret Agent"")

In addition to the MS1 Military Watch Set, we're also offering 4 different NATO Strap Packs that can be purchased as an add-on or on their own. Aside from ""The Officer"" which is made out of genuine leather, each strap is made from ballistic nylon, with stainless steel hardware and are 22MM wide.
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $225.
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $239.
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $239.
• 1 x Navy Blue / Red NATO Strap
• 1 x Navy Blue / White NATO Strap
Receive with The MS1 Military Watch Set When You Pledge $259.
Kingsbury offers a limited warranty against defects in materials and workmanship for a period of One (1) year after original purchase from Kingsbury Watch Co.

This means that if the components or materials of your watch have any issues, or if the watch isn’t functioning correctly, we’ll repair or replace it (at our discretion). We don't cover normal wear and tear, broken or damaged crystal, watch case, strap, bracelet and loss or theft. You will void your warranty if you open the caseback, or forget to screw down or push in the crown and expose the internal components of your watch to moisture.

Proof of purchase is required for all warranty claims and service requests, so hold onto your unique serial dog tag, this is the ID for your warranty. Kingsbury will not accept a warranty claim or repair request if a watch has evidence of excessive wear or misuse.

All rewards will be shipped from either Upstate New York or Toronto, Canada depending on your location.

 

Risks &

Since we're already passed the prototype phase and have all the sourcing completed, we don't anticipate any major setbacks. Our main challenge will be getting production and QC done in time to meet our our shipping deadlines. With all the planning we've done to reach this point, we're not anticipating any major setbacks.

We are fully capable of handling any issues that might arise as our team has previous experience sourcing and manufacturing products. We will be transparent with backers throughout the process, and will give frequent updates and answer any questions from backers.
We are confident in our manufacturing and our quality control and believe strongly that we'll be able to meet our shipping goal.

Once we're fully funded, we're planning on keeping the production running so that we can sell the MS1 Military Watch Set in participating retail stores and through our website.A 20% of the net proceeds from the sales of this watch set will be donated to help various veterans causes - mainly to aid wounded military veterans as well as those suffering from PTSD. Some of the organizations we'll work with do great work like suicide prevention, providing supplemental health care as well as career counseling. We also have some ideas on how to get our backer community involved. This is a worthy cause that deserves more attention and we’re proud to do our small part.   With its simple lines, clean dials and vintage looks, the MS1 was designed and developed over a period of 8 months. What you see now is the final result of many experiments with movements and components to bring you a refined, high quality watch at a price that can't be refused.  You get both watches as part of the set: The MS1 was built to be the following:
Tough - Built solid, with high quality materials to get you through all the messy situations.
Reliable - With a trusted movement that can be powered for 3 years on one battery.
Minimal - A vintage look and feel inspired by mission critical military aircraft instruments.
Functional - An easy-to-view date function and chronograph seamlessly integrated into the design.
Value - Get a lot for a little. Having no middlemen allows us to build you premium timepieces for a minimal cost.

To ensure a sturdy build, we had to use stainless steel to forge the MS1 casing. With a thin bezel around the watch, we thought a 42mm diameter case (measured w/o the crown) would be the perfect size for any wrist. It's not oversized if you have a smaller wrist, and it's definitely not too small if your wrist is larger. With a total height of 10MM and a weight of 59 grams (with a nylon strap), it feels good on the wrist. Protecting the face of the watch, you'll find scratch resistant sapphire glass. Coupled with the stainless steel case and backing, the combination gives this watch a water resistance of 5ATM which will be fine under water during showers and swims.  Powering the MS1 Watch Collection is the Seiko (TMI) VD51 Japanese quartz movement. It has a minute, hour and second hand, as well as a date function at the 3PM location. The date window has been carefully cut to ensure it can be read easily - no need to squint as you check to see what day it is. An added bonus to the Seiko VD51 is the chronograph function which has two dials to measure seconds and minutes. These are activated and reset by two pushers located on opposite sides of the crown. The movement can be powered up to 3 years on one battery (Sony battery included).  To complete the vintage military look on the MS1, we added a NATO style strap. These 22MM wide straps are made out of ballistic nylon, have stainless steel hardware and can be removed with little effort - no tools required. The MS1 Watch Set comes with 2 additional NATO straps and 2 additional ZULU style straps to give you a nice combination of colors / looks. All straps in the following pictures are included in the watch set: See just how easy it is to switch straps:

We carried the military theme right over to our packaging with a rustic wooden military crate. Inside each crate, two MS1 watches will sit, nestled on a burlap pillow. That’s right - each package will contain two watches - in two different color finishes with interchangeable NATO straps. So whether combat ready, in dress blues or civies, the MS1 allows you to style your timepiece according to your wardrobe.

Each MS1 Military Watch Set comes with a special embossed dog tag. This dog tag has a serial number that is unique to each watch set, it indicates the production run/series, the production year and the watch number.
Each MS1 Watch Set includes the following:
MS1 Chronograph Watch in black/black with black NATO watch strap
MS1 Chronograph Watch in silver/white with army green NATO watch strap
Hand made wooden military crate box
Military dog tag with unique serial number
Extra red/white/blue striped NATO watch strap (""The Patriot)
Extra black/grey striped NATO watch strap (""The Secret Agent"")
Extra army green ZULU watch strap

In addition to the MS1 Military Watch Set, we're also offering 4 different NATO Strap Packs that can be purchased as an add-on or on their own. Aside from ""The Officer"" which is made out of genuine leather, each strap is made from ballistic nylon, with stainless steel hardware and are 22MM wide.
NATO Strap Pack 1 - ""A Few Good Men"":
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $225.
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $239.
Receive with The MS1 Watch Set When You Pledge $239.
1 x Navy Blue / Red NATO Strap
1 x Navy Blue / White NATO Strap
Receive with The MS1 Military Watch Set When You Pledge $259.
Kingsbury offers a limited warranty against defects in materials and workmanship for a period of One (1) year after original purchase from Kingsbury Watch Co.

This means that if the components or materials of your watch have any issues, or if the watch isn’t functioning correctly, we’ll repair or replace it (at our discretion). We don't cover normal wear and tear, broken or damaged crystal, watch case, strap, bracelet and loss or theft. You will void your warranty if you open the caseback, or forget to screw down or push in the crown and expose the internal components of your watch to moisture.

Proof of purchase is required for all warranty claims and service requests, so hold onto your unique serial dog tag, this is the ID for your warranty. Kingsbury will not accept a warranty claim or repair request if a watch has evidence of excessive wear or misuse.
All rewards will be shipped from either Upstate New York or Toronto, Canada depending on your location. Risks & Challenges:

Since we're already passed the prototype phase and have all the sourcing completed, we don't anticipate any major setbacks. Our main challenge will be getting production and QC done in time to meet our our shipping deadlines. With all the planning we've done to reach this point, we're not anticipating any major setbacks.

We are fully capable of handling any issues that might arise as our team has previous experience sourcing and manufacturing products. We will be transparent with backers throughout the process, and will give frequent updates and answer any questions from backers.
We are confident in our manufacturing and our quality control and believe strongly that we'll be able to meet our shipping goal.",37.0,1,"2 Campaigns

Have you ever wanted to go to a cosplay event but not had a costume to wear, and the only available ones are those companies in china?
Have you ever looked for a Cosplay or Lolita dress pattern and been unable to find a suitable size, good instruction, or availability in your area?
Have you ever suffered from Simplicity patterns, which promise great things, but have no guidelines and often end up being an awful fit in the wrong fabric?
Well Rapture Costumiers is here to bridge the gap.

My name is Hayley Morris and I am 25 and just finishing uni. This indigogo even will finish just in time for the end of uni where i can throw my full attention into this job. I am smart, a nerd, excellent with computers and eager to merge computers and fashion together.I also apologise in advance for my video, I am not a media student but felt it would be honest to put a video together for you.

This project is important to me because it means in the future i may be able to sustain myself in a business, it will be the groundwork for my future, it will allow me to put my heart and soul into creating something wonderful for people to use and buy cheaply from me without the normal hassle associated with sewing clothes.

By helping me, you will define a need in an industry that people have long since forgotten. You will prove that people WANT to make things themselves, that there is an area long too ignored. This is the fact that women are wearing the wrong sized clothes or they just can't get clothes in their size. Plus sizes in different body shapes are ignored, too wide on the hips- you must be 6 foot tall, aren't you? Didn't think so.

The project I propose is to make my University collection ""Renaissance Lolita"" into digitised patterns by using auto cad or a similar programme. This will enable the consumer to purchase a pattern pack from me for £10 which will include 1 garment pattern in sizes 8-22 with instructions on how to put the dress  together and how to alter the pattern for the perfect fit for yourself if need be. The dresses use a lot of smocking and instructions for this will also be included if you wish to smock or pipe any sections of the dresses. It will also have suggestions of fabric types and ideas for making the dresses more individual to yourselves. Each pack will have a list of measurements for each pattern in centimetres and inches so you can choose the best fit. Custom patterns can be made on request at a slightly higher price and larger sizes can be whipped up on request at a later date.

The dress patterns will be in PDF format, to the correct size, so that you can print them on A4 sheets from your home printer. You line them up, selotape or masking tape together, cut out, use, abuse and throw away when you're done because they will be right there in your pc waiting for you. If you lose your pattern file make sure you either put your email in a safe folder in your account or just drop me an email and I will resend you the file. You bought it, you own it DRM free. No passwords, no hassle.
Scroll down for images of the collection and more information.
-A licensed legal version of Progecad to make all my patterns legal to distribute. £250
-A license for Xara designer pro, a programme similar to illustrator but considerably cheaper. £250

-Most of the money will buy 'time'. I currently work part time at ASDA. The wages pay rent to my grandmother which we would not afford to eat without and also to pay off some debt. This will not change and your money will provide security that will enabe me to work on this project 4 days of the week and will allow me to be the best that I can be.

Without your pledges I will have to work full time at ASDA and this will make the process last longer. I would like to get the groundworks and first project completed so that I can make more projects that the public want. The more money, the more time to make what you want. In the long run i would like to be able to sustain myself on my business and eventually make one off pieces for those who want to buy a garment rather than a pattern.
$3000 is roughly £1700, after buying the 2 programmes, £1200 will be enough to last 3 months of living. Roughly the same amount I have available for a semester at uni.

If you pledge just $10 you get 1 pattern pack, and $40 gets you all 4. In comparison to english money it means you are getting the packs for around £6 each. I want to be able to work hard to achieve this well before December so I can then move on to other Lolita garments, and costume items. I am happy to also design androgynous costumes, for example- a mans outfit for a woman.   Think of your pledge as a pre purchase of the pattern packs. You will get exactly the same quality of item that will be available on my website for a cheaper price.
Even if the goal isn't met I will use the money to at least buy the programmes I need and this project will happen, just over a longer period.
By this point you're probably wondering about the dresses, or you've scrolled down because you want to know about the dresses first.

My collection is based Lolita style clothes which, if you don't know, are normally ultra cute dresses or trouser suits based on Victorian design. So tight bodices, full perfect frilly skirts. It comes from Japan and is originally based on alice in wonderland. I chose to create a new category of Lolita garments called Renaissance Lolita. Using research from paintings of famous renaissance figures, and games such as Assassins creed and Deus Ex (futuristic renaissance) I decided to concentrate my project on smocking, piping and ruffs, whist keeping the traditional Lolita silhouette.
This project is 100% my work, my copyright. All dress patterns that made up the dresses are designed by me, the dresses were made by me.
The 4 dresses in my collection are divided into two dresses with double skirts and 2 dresses with single. Each dress displays its' own individual characteristics.
Bianca - A dress with a wide neckline with no sleeves. It has a kirtle style split  skirt and hand smocked waist.
Vittoria- A single skirted dress with pleated symettrical detail down the front. It has shirred sleeves in a smocked fashion with a lozenge smocked back panel.
Caterina- A double skirted dress with firm piped waist, faux shoulder straps, mutton sleeves and hand stitched honey comb smock cuffs.
Lucrezia- A high ruff neck with pleat pressed front and lower edge frill. It has lattice detail on the back.

The dresses are priced quite high because of the amount of hand sewing involved. Caterina alone is £350 because of the amount of hours put into the hand stitched sleeves and piped waist. I do not believe people should have to buy my dress from me fully made. Having a choice between the ready made product and the pattern should be available to people. Imagine going into a designer store, you can't afford the £200 shirt but they have the pattern. You buy it for £20 get your own fabrics and make it the way you want in a perfect fit. This is how the future should be, we should have a choice in how we wear our clothes and where we get them from. if you make a beautiful product you'll be more likely to keep it in your wardrobe and not feel so bad about dismantling it and reusing the fabrics if you want to. In the long run this could cut down a lot of consumer waist and create some brand new fashion designers ready to self publish themselves.

To make a garment pattern you always start with a block. The first task will be to design the garment blocks in CAD using the smallest size. Then each pattern piece is manipulated into the shapes required, so whether you turn a dart into a seam, hike the skirt up, make it longer, fan it out, move the waist line, move the dart, shorten the sleeve, puff the sleeve...etc, I'm sure there are more things you can do to a pattern.

Once the patterns are set you add seam allowance, cut them out of fabric and test the size and shape of your lines. If any alterations are needed you take notes and apply them into the programme. Then you grade up the pattern into all the other sizes and add on seam allowance, or vice versa. All patterns are then cut out and tested. In this case it's probably easier to make the largest then unpick and keep using the smaller pattern piece. The largest size must also be tested for consistency to make sure the grading is correct. This obviously takes a lot of time to make sure you are getting the best deal for your $10.

Eight toiles (mockups) minimum must be tested before the patterns are finalised. They will then be made into separate PDF files so you may choose which size and use less ink in the printing process. These will be 8,10,12,16,18,20 and 22 (UK sizing) Measurements supplied.
This is obviously a lot of work and it must be complete x4. That's essentially 32 mock ups and all of it takes time.

Copyright information: Costume and dress shapes come under utilitarian by law. This means the shapes cannot be copyrighted. Only graphics and fabrics are copyrightable. This means, although patterns will be unofficial and by no means endorsed by the anime or video game companies, they will be legal for you to buy and use as dress patterns are merely fabric shapes.

If you can't contribute, no worries, help me get the word out, help me advertise around the net, try and get it on kotaku (along the lines of Kotaku East/meets west), tell people you know on facebook or twitter, on your blog, anywhere you can think. Pass it on to women who sew, women who design, curvy ladies, otaku's, cosplay addicts, video gamers. Anyone you know. Send me a message to let me know how you advertised so I can thank you personally. Remember you can use the indigogo sharing tools.

In the future I am hoping Rapture Costumiers will turn into the go to place for Corset patterns, Lolita patterns, Cosplay patterns, dresses, jackets, period tops and skirts etc. I hope it will supply a new ability in people who will be more willing to make themselves clothing and be less scared of the first hurdle.I know it has put me off in the past. I hope that through my future patterns it creates a new standard in pattern cutting for beginners and hobbyists and hope that those that pledge for me will join me on facebook to help me choose which projects I make in future.

I have every intention in the future of setting up a database where other people can submit their pattern designs for sale where I take a small profit of 5-10% and people can sell their cosplay patterns etc through the same website. Anyone interested in the web design aspect or submitting their patterns in the future or just plain interest, please email me at hvmorris23@ymail.com

Please also visit my other links down the bottom of the page. These will show you past uni projects I undertook, also linkedin for my background and CV, and my own website as well, which will, in future, home the pattern shop.

My name is Shen Cook and I am 15 years old. I have lived in Athens my entire life and I love it here. Luckily, Athens has a youth hockey program, so I fell in love with ice hockey when I was 9. When I was 12, I became interested in goaltending and that's what I have done ever since then. Unfortunately, this is the most expensive position as far as equipment goes. All of my leg pads and gloves have been hand-me-downs. My current set of leg pads are too small and leave part of my legs exposed. Puck to the leg = Pain. If I can't raise the money for another set, I'm afraid it could very well mean that I won't be playing hockey this season. This would set me a step behind everyone else in the future, making the rest of my varsity hockey experience more difficult than it should be.

The leg pads I want will cost about $480 (that's cheap for leg pads). If I can raise more funds than that I will use them to buy a new stick or a face cage, or perhaps both. My stick is getting too short which can be hard on the back due to leaning over too far, and my cage is badly rusted.
It only takes a $25 donation to receive a perk! Check them out below. If you can't donate that much, even $5 or $10 will make a huge difference.

Like I said earlier, getting these pads before hockey starts up again is very important to me. If I can't get them, it will likely end my life of hockey. Any help you can give would be much appreciated.
Please tell anyone you can about this. Thank you for your help.

My name is Chrissi ""Leadfoot"" Dees and Leadfoot Shirts is not just another screen printing company.  It was created to ensure quality custom apparel could be had by anyone in any quantity at an affordable price, even just one shirt!  The original motivation was to provide the affordable apparel to the paintball community, which has been successfully done for the past year and a half, but it certainly is not limited to that.

Most of the profits to this point have had to go back into the business to purchase additional supplies such as inks, screens, squeegees, etc. as well as pay some bills along the way.  The new equipment will take Leadfoot Shirts to another level, being able to produce even more of the same quality screen printed apparel but at greatly reduced turnaround times.  I cannot do it without your help!
Upgraded equipment will at least quadruple my productivity, allowing more people to be able to get affordable custom screen printed apparel!
I need approximately $10,000 to be able to purchase a quality, professional level press, conveyor dryer, flash cure with temperature control and various supplies.

I am offering an array of unique perks that will only be available to those that make a contribution to this campaign.  Each supporter will receive a personal e-mail thank you from me in addition to any claimed perk(s).  I will also have a banner made to hang in my printing area with each contributors name surrounding a ""Leadfoot Shirts Supporters"" logo as a daily reminder of the people who believe in my vision.
If the entire goal is not met the funds will still go toward the equipment upgrades, it will just take a little longer.

However, if the campaign gets fully funded I will give each person that contributed at least $25 15% off one future order of apparel/microfibers, etc whether you order 1, 100, or more!  That is another way for me to show you all my appreciation if we can get this done but I cannot do it without YOU!

If there is a perk you would like to see let me know and I will look at adding it, especially if you are the member of a paintball team or business that would like to lend your support by allowing me to print a limited edition shirt or other item to help the cause!

**The pricing of each perk INCLUDES standard ground shipping via USPS to the continental USA only, please contact me for the additional shipping to anywhere else.**

***T-Shirt packs can include a limited amount of shirts in sizes 2X and up, 3 in 12 packs, 6 in 24 packs)***
How does your contribution make a difference?

Your support of Leadfoot Shirts will help solidify the company and put me in a better situation to be able to provide even more quality apparel at affordable prices to everyone.  The new equipment will also maximize the use of the limited time I have available to print orders.  You can rest assured knowing that your contribution will go toward the purchase of new equipment and supplies only, nothing else!
You may not be able to contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please tell everyone you know about Leadfoot Shirts and how they can help by sending the link to this campaign via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else you can.

And that’s all there is to it.  I hope you will help me make Leadfoot Shirts a household name in apparel screen printing!

","What/Who is Leadfoot Shirts?

My name is Chrissi ""Leadfoot"" Dees and Leadfoot Shirts is not just another screen printing company.  It was created to ensure quality custom apparel could be had by anyone in any quantity at an affordable price, even just one shirt!  The original motivation was to provide the affordable apparel to the paintball community, which has been successfully done for the past year and a half, but it certainly is not limited to that.

Most of the profits to this point have had to go back into the business to purchase additional supplies such as inks, screens, squeegees, etc. as well as pay some bills along the way.  The new equipment will take Leadfoot Shirts to another level, being able to produce even more of the same quality screen printed apparel but at greatly reduced turnaround times.  I cannot do it without your help!
Upgraded equipment will at least quadruple my productivity, allowing more people to be able to get affordable custom screen printed apparel!
What Leadfoot Shirts Needs & What You Get
I need approximately $10,000 to be able to purchase a quality, professional level press, conveyor dryer, flash cure with temperature control and various supplies.

I am offering an array of unique perks that will only be available to those that make a contribution to this campaign.  Each supporter will receive a personal e-mail thank you from me in addition to any claimed perk(s).  I will also have a banner made to hang in my printing area with each contributors name surrounding a ""Leadfoot Shirts Supporters"" logo as a daily reminder of the people who believe in my vision.
If the entire goal is not met the funds will still go toward the equipment upgrades, it will just take a little longer.

However, if the campaign gets fully funded I will give each person that contributed at least $25 15% off one future order of apparel/microfibers, etc whether you order 1, 100, or more!  That is another way for me to show you all my appreciation if we can get this done but I cannot do it without YOU!

If there is a perk you would like to see let me know and I will look at adding it, especially if you are the member of a paintball team or business that would like to lend your support by allowing me to print a limited edition shirt or other item to help the cause!**The pricing of each perk INCLUDES standard ground shipping via USPS to the continental USA only, please contact me for the additional shipping to anywhere else.*****T-Shirt packs can include a limited amount of shirts in sizes 2X and up, 3 in 12 packs, 6 in 24 packs)***
How does your contribution make a difference?

Your support of Leadfoot Shirts will help solidify the company and put me in a better situation to be able to provide even more quality apparel at affordable prices to everyone.  The new equipment will also maximize the use of the limited time I have available to print orders.  You can rest assured knowing that your contribution will go toward the purchase of new equipment and supplies only, nothing else!
You may not be able to contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please tell everyone you know about Leadfoot Shirts and how they can help by sending the link to this campaign via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else you can.
And that’s all there is to it.  I hope you will help me make Leadfoot Shirts a household name in apparel screen printing!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Cammie, or Clarissa. I am a self taught seamstress presently working for Wolfhome Adventuring Outfitters, presently specializing in historical Japanese clothing. I have been sewing for the last 25 years. I was taught by my Grandmother, as well as teaching myself for some of the more difficult things. I received two years of formal education when I was 13 from Mrs. Wilburn, my then Home Economics instructor. I am a cancer survivor.

Making 31 is about achieving a dream. 11 years ago I wanted to go to college for fashion design. That did not happen, but what did happen is I never lost my desire to learn about fashion. I am seeking to raise funds to travel to Japan to study with some of the fashion designers whom I have been following for years. This is the dream I gave up on when I was 22. I don't want to give up on them anymore. I want to make them a reality.

By assisting in the Making 31 project you will be helping me make a dream come true. I have passionately lived for fashion throughout my entire life. I just never really had the platform to launch myself from. I am hoping to have your assistance in building that platform.
This is to cover the cost of a

column2: >travel expenses to and from Japan (Luggage, and Plane tickets)
>a 3 week stay (Lodging, Food, and other amenities)
>the fee's for a translator (I do not presently speak Japanese.)
>the cost of any materials I may need while I am there (In case I end up working on a project while I am there.)
>as well as to ship things home (There is really only so much room in the Luggage)

column1: • Postcards From Japan. (I am limiting this to 10, Mainly because I will only have so many hours in a day.)
• Specialized access to a personal blog of my adventure in this learning process. As well as projects I am planning to work on.
• Limited Edition Art Prints 1-100 of the Original sketch as a print.
• Limited Edition Art Prints 1-50 of the Original Sketch in full color.

• Limited to 4, 3D printed Ball jointed pony dolls from Silverbeam's Magic. Customized by me from my inspirations from Japan. The doll's are super adorable to begin with. They are able to be fully customized.

• Limited to 4 Hand crochet realistic Face Huggers. A very good friend of mine makes these terrifyingly realistic Face Huggers all out of Crochet. I love them, she has very sweetly agreed to make four of these for me.

•  Limited to 2, custom outfit designed by me. I will work with you to discover exactly what you like and what you don't like. This is so that you will come away with a garment that you love wearing as much as I love making it.

Being realistic and knowing that this dream may not become a reality right now. Any funds that I manage to raise, will go to furthering my education in the development of patterns, tailoring, and design. I will try again and if I have to I will make my trip shorter. So that I can at the very least, meet one of the people who has so inspired me.

Making 31 is about finally being given the chance to open your wings to see if you can fly after being trapped in a cage. Cancer was a cage of fear. I was afraid to actually reach for my dream because I was terrified that it would be ripped away all over again. This is a restoration of hope. I believe that my ideas and my designs have a place in this world. I want a chance to polish my education so that I can potentially prove that to everyone.
At the end of the day Making 31 isn't just about me. It is about you. You see we all grow up with hopes and dreams. Some of us haven't forgotten them. I want to prove that it is never to late to try and live your dreams. For that I need your help. I know I can not do this on my own. So I am asking you to help me by Making 31. 
I have finally managed to beat cancer once and for all. I believe that I can make this dream a reality. I have every intention of starting up my own business designing clothing for the open market that looks great, makes you feel great, and is comfortable. I am going to tackle this head on and come out of it on top.
Now I know not everyone will be able to donate. Every little bit certainly helps towards my goal. So even if all you do is get the word out, and share what Making 31 is about, that would be wonderfully helpful.
","Hello Everyone,

My name is Cammie, or Clarissa. I am a self taught seamstress presently working for Wolfhome Adventuring Outfitters, presently specializing in historical Japanese clothing. I have been sewing for the last 25 years. I was taught by my Grandmother, as well as teaching myself for some of the more difficult things. Believe it or not crime happening frequently and muggers can show up anytime, any where. How about carrying a baseball bat or learn some  marshal art? If you think this is a good idea than let me intro you our new idea which is more efficient and less time consuming then learning a martisal art... the  Self defense wallet comb.
Self defense wallet comb a tiny device that can fit in any wallet and undetectable easy by the bad guys, this will enable you to create a good opportunity to response or escape.
The metal device measures in at 100mm x 65mm which fit in to the standard everyday wallet with easy, this is a unique tool that can be broken into 2 separate pieces

1. Use As a Wood Saw

2. Rope Tightener
The design has been refined over last 3 months with several rounds of prototypes, materials , the design and performance test,the wallet Self defense is ready to begin for manufacturing.

That is where you come in. Funding is needed to move forward with tooling and production of the Wallet self defense comb. By selecting one of the available package, you will help us in reaching our goal.

Since development work of the product is complete, work can begin on tooling and production once this crowdfunding campaign is over (early-October) and funds received from IndieGoGo (1-2 weeks thereafter).  Once received it will immediately go towards the deposit on the tooling.  Tooling has been estimated to be 6-8 weeks and production at 2 weeks. Fulfillment of the package will be during the first half of December, if everything else goes as planned.

Hargreaves will devote 100% of your contribution profit to the campaign you choose (calculated by deducting production costs, shipping costs and applicable taxes from the contribution)

Once you have chosen the project you want to collaborate with, choose the Hargreaves you like:
Una vez hayas elegido el proyecto con el que quieres colaborar, elige las Hargreaves que mas te gusten:

MOZAMBIQUE SUR Foundation, contributing to the sustainable and equitable development of 40,000 people in extreme poverty in South Mozambique, is responsible of Casa do Gaiato orphanage. With this campaign we will help feeding in a healthy manner 152 children and young people in this orphanage.

La Fundación MOZAMBIQUE SUR,que contribuye al desarrollo sostenible y equitativo de 40.000 personas en situación de pobreza extrema en el sur de Mozambique, es responsable del orfanato Casa do Gaiato. Mediante esta campaña ayudaremos a proporcionar una alimentación equilibrada a 152 niños y jóvenes de este orfanato.

SOS MUJER gives support, care and help to alleviate the dramatic situation of Indian widows. After their husbands death, they are deprived of all their belongings and obliged to live in poverty in the sacred city of Vrindavan and surroundings. With this campaign we will help to give care and free medication to the widows.

SOS MUJER ofrece soporte y ayuda para solucionar la dramática situación que viven las viudas en India. Una vez fallecido su cónyuge, son despojadas de sus pertenencias y relegadas a malvivir en la ciudad sagrada de Vrindavan y sus alrededores. Mediante esta campaña ayudaremos a proporcionar atención y medicación gratuita a estas viudas.

INFANCIA SOLIDARIA helps underprivileged children in developing countries who need surgery which is not available and affordable to them in their own countries. With this campaign we will help covering their travel expenses to Spain.

INFANCIA SOLIDARIA ayuda a niños sin recursos procedentes de países en vías de desarrollo que necesitan una operación quirúrgica y que no pueden operarse en sus países de origen. Mediante esta campaña ayudaremos a contribuir en el pago de sus desplazamientos médicos a España.

Once you make your contribution, you will receive an e-mail asking about the

It is not possible to split your donation between more than one NGO.

Una vez finalizada la campaña de crowdfunding, podrás adquirir tus sneakers

¿Cómo elijo el proyecto en el que colaboro?
El proyecto se elige en el momento en que seleccionas la recompensa con la
que quieres colaborar. De hecho, la recompensa lleva el nombre de la causa
social a la que va a ir dirigido el dinero recaudado con tu aportación.
Una vez hayas realizado la aportación, recibirás  un correo en el que te solicitaremos la talla
y el color en el que quieres las sneakers. Además, te aportaremos información extendida sobre el proyecto con el que has decidido colaborar.
¿Puedo elegir repartir mi aportación entre dos ONG?
Las aportaciones vienen establecidas para cada proyecto y ONG en las
recompensas. Por lo tanto, no es posible elegir que el dinero de tu aportación sea dirigido a
¿Cómo puedo estar informado de que mi dinero ha
Una vez acabada la campaña de crowdfunding, la ONG con la que hayas decidido colaborar te enviará un correo electrónico informándote de que tu contribución ha sido enviada a dicha organización.

Cada ONG dispondrá del nombre, apellido y correo electrónico de las personas que hayan colaborado en su proyecto para que, en caso de duda, los colaboradores puedan preguntar directamente si su contribución ha sido registrada.
¿Puedo hacer un donativo sin comprar unas Hargreaves?
Existen dos maneras de realizar donativos a las ONGs con las que colaboramos en esta campaña.
Puedes hacerlo mediante esta campaña de crowdfunding contribuyendo sin comprar recompensa. En ese caso nos pondremos en contacto contigo para conocer con qué campaña quieres colaborar.
Si lo prefieres, puedes realizar el donativo enviando el dinero directamente a las ONGs mediante su página web. A continuación te facilitamos los links:
