column1: In our everyday life we are

surrounded with mass produced, molded plastic products – all identical and often cheap. A stereotype of plastic as a low value, individuality lacking material is strong.   we are disrupting this perceptionWith years of engineering and designing on the edge of art and technology, we discovered a completely new processes - plastic is shaped in the hands of the artist literally in the air. As a result a familiar material takes new staggering forms, deep and rich textures of jewelry with truly luxurious and smart touch. The possibilities, processes and final result are fascinating.
PLASTIC IS FORMED BY HANDS LITERALLY
IN THE AIRWe have to be fast and precise from the first take. Each piece is different from the other by the nature of their production. They may be the same style, but every item is unique.
Different and perfect. Every single one.
OUR JEWELRY LOOKS SMART AND CHIC WITH  ANY OUTFIT BE IT BUSINESS SUIT, EVENING DRESS OR BEACHWEAR
YOU CAN WEAR AND WATCH THEM ENDLESSLY
TRANSPARENT PIECES LOOK MARVELOUS IN THE MOONLIGHT
AS WELL AS IN THE DAYLIGHT,
There are no two identical forms in nature nor two identical people. There are no identical 1&U items either.
1&U jewelry is the result of long and passionate engineering and creation. Now we are ready to share it with you.

With your donations you are essentially preordering 1&U jewelry for the reduced price.  Specially for this campaign we set flat prices for all styles of bracelets and rings. It is 35$ for a bracelet and 25$ for a ring.

We prepared even more attractive deals for those of you, who come on board first and help our campaign to kick off. Check early birds for details. As our supporter you will have a lifetime 15% discount on our web store as soon as it starts.

We produce everything in-house and we are ready to get down to work as soon as you place your order. You will receive your 1&U piece within 2 months after this campaign comes to an end. Moreover, some of our supporters may receive their order even before the end of campaign.
All styles come in 3 sizes, and in your post-project survey we'll ask you to clarify witch style, size and color you wish.
colors: black, white, clear (transparent, no color)
colors: black, white, clear (transparent, no color)
colors: black, white on transparent base
colors: black, white, clear (transparent, no color)
colors: black, white, clear (transparent, no color)
Please note you may be responsible for customs, duties, fees and taxes appllicable in your region.
There are many ways to contribute!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign! You would help us a lot by sharing this campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons and let the world know about 1&U.",62.0,0,"3 Campaigns

A pomegranate goes around the world

In 2005 Alexander Kranz, a german graphic designer, wanted to design a series of postcards for the 90th anniversary of the armenian genocide to get people to recognize and remember the genocide.

""As a graphic designer I wanted to design something beautiful instead of something horrible or genocide stereotype, so that people will pick up the postcard because they like the beauty of it and only at a second glance learn what it's all about"", explains Alexander Kranz.

The design of Alexander Kranz with the pomegranate with a deep cut as a symbol of the genocide of the armenians has been used by armenian organizations worldwide to promote events dedicated to the armenian genocide.
column6:
>Spread the word with a T-Shirt

On my website you can see images of organizations using posters with the symbol. If all these people would also wear a T-Shirt with the symbol, they could spread the word also in their everyday life instead at demonstrations only. With the money of this campaign I will be able to:

column1: • print a bigger edition of T-Shirts, so that they will be ready for the 24th April
• deliver the shirts more quickly because I already pre-printed

• get a better print quality: shirts have to be printed as all-over print (sublimation), so that the pomegrenate is huge and covers the front of the body (more expensive), this way the T-Shirt works more like a fashion item than a political T-Shirt: people will like to wear it because it looks nice

column5:
>Still a lot of people have never heard about  the genocide of the armenians


Help to raise people's awareness of the genocide that was committed in 1915. Only if people learn about a genocide, they can discuss it.

column1: • 1.6 mio. armenians were killed, help to remember them
• The pomegranate poster was already used in Newspapers and as a book cover

Share if you don't donate

  • Even if you don't donate please spread the word about this t-shirt campaign

column5: >Outdoor Tech® - The same outdoor designer brand that delivered the Turtle Shell® and Big Turtle Shell®, are now asking

column1: for your help in launcing the Kodiak Power Bank Line - the pinnacle of rugged + waterproof portable chargers.

This is not your typical power bank line.  The Kodiak Power Bank Line is IP67 - waterproof, dustproof, and shockproof - and ready for anything you can throw at it.  The Kodiak Power Bank Collection will give you power in any setting
column2: from the backcountry, sitting on a lift before your next run, to the beach, the Kodiak can handle it all with style and

column1:
PRESS
Uncrate: ""There are plenty of battery packs out there that can keep your gadgets
charged on the go, but few of them can stand up to the elements like the

Outdoor Tech Kodiak...""

Adventure.com Recommended Gear: ""Fully waterproof and shockproof to the elements, the rugged portable Kodiak power bank is made for any environment...all while being small and lightweight for travel.""

ActiveLifeStore.com: ""To put it simply the Outdoor Tech Kodiak 6000 is the next big thing in mobile charging units...[and] will keep you plugged in no matter how far you are from civilization.""
The evolution of Outdoor Tech® has been shaped by this constant push and pull, to stay connected but not tethered.
blood boils with design, style and creation.  From our magical home in
Southern California we aim to create products that serve real needs, for
real people that do real things.  We don't define ourselves by the
space that confines us, but we do draw from it.
bridge the gap between great design and accessories for an active
lifestyle by creating Stuff You Probably Want.

The Kodiak Mini 2.2K - say hello to our little friend. An ultra-portable power bank that packs a big charge in a tiny package. Perfect when size and weight are a major concern and you don't want to be  out of luck when you are out of power. 2200 mAh of power in a compact and easily pocketable size. IP67 - fully waterproof, dustproof, and shockproof.
Think of the Kodiak 6K as your portable universal
power bank best buddy.  Rugged and durable - IP67 waterproof and dustproof.  Never worry about running out of power ever again, regardless of the conditions. Charge anything with a USB
connection using its huge 6000 milliamp battery.

The Kodiak Plus 10K is for the hungriest of devices. Capable of charging multiple devices simultaneously with its dual USB ports. Charge anything via USB multiple times over with its huge 10000 mAh battery. Rugged and durable - IP67 waterproof and dustproof.
BACKER PERKS

We love crowdfunding.  It gives us a chance to connect with our most ardent users.  The early adopters - the same people who are on the first lift of the day.  Our kind of people.  Late nights into early mornings - The Kodiak is your best friend.
We aren't a billion dollar company and don't have to play by those rules.  We can leverage the crowd to innovate.  Leverage the crowd to bring you stuff you probably want.

We need your support to cover the tooling for the Kodiak Mini 2200 and Kodiak Plus 10000.  Crowdfunding gives us the opportunity to grow on our own terms, and also keeps us from having to put on a suit to visit banks.

THE OUTDOOR TECH TEAM

We are a passionate and scrappy group of product
developers and designers determined to bring you Stuff You Probably Want.
Our products have been shaped by the constant push and pull, of staying connected but not tethered to our devices.  To be in the moment to capture the moment.
blood boils with design, style and creation.  From our magical home in
Southern California we aim to create products that serve real needs, for
real people who do real things.  We don't define ourselves by the
space that confines us, but we do draw from it.
bridge the gap between great design and accessories for an active

lifestyle by creating Stuff You Probably Want.

Now help us launch our Kodiak Power Bank collection!  You can be one of
the first to have the rugged, super portable, and aesthetically
Our team has done its best to mitigate the risks and challenges for this project.
Outdoor Tech is no newbie to crowdfunding, we learned a
great deal from the support and feedback from our first two successful
projects and delivered EVERY SINGLE UNIT in a reasonable timeframe, and
we are prepared to do even better this time.

The Kodiak 6000 launch surpassed our expectations, and we're working with the same production partner to launch the Kodiak Mini 2200 and Kodiak Plus 10000. We went through a 6+ month development process and
are excited with where we currently stand.
Having worked with our manufacturer for 3 years we can vouch for
their quality and reliability. We've got a firm production schedule and
are confident in our suppliers and vendors for both the inputs and
That said, there are inherent risks of delay in the process. We will
communicate with both our backers and our manufacturer throughout the
campaign to ensure the fulfillment timeline stays true.

column2: The Perfect Solution to a Messy Problem!

column1: Picking up your dogs fresh 'dinners past' upon deposit and getting rid of it ASAP

...a case to carry dog waste, discretely, with style, odor free and hands free when you are walking your dog, especially in areas that do not have frequent convenient trash cans i.e.  neighborhoods, the beach, boating, hiking, camping and so forth… I wanted to enjoy my walk, hands free, and not limit my treks to planning around waste stations and trash cans.

My main objective in designing my case was to design a product that was durable and light weight but most importantly a case that had a rigid frame so that you could pop your package in it and be worry free of smell, accidents and of the ‘package’ touching other items…  With PoopPac you can now pop the case in your car, stroller, attach it to your backpack, belt, leash etc. and relax until you cross a convenient trash can or until you return home.  With PoopPac you are hands free to enjoy your walk!
PoopPac Features and Specs (links to more detailed info on the PoopPac)
Schlepping smelly waste bags, with coffee in the other hand, managing a stroller, children, more than one dog... it's a challenge! Raining, gloves, carrying waste
column2: yuk and so inconvenient. There must be a better way? And now there is

column1: Field market research proved the PoopPac concept to be a great hit and the PoopPac received fabulous feedback, testimonials and media reviews. In fact in Sept 2012 PoopPac was invited to participate in the Emmy's gifting lounge! However at the same time as having all of this super product acceptance, sadly my local manufacturer, having been in business for 20 years, closed down just as I was bringing the PoopPac's to market. Hmmm
column2: quite the challenge as manufacturing locally allowed me to place small and frequent orders, meant no shipping and storage costs, and offered very short leadtimes, thus allowing me to go into production as a small self-funded start-up.

column1: Losing local manufacturing means increased costs for shipping and storage and thus the need to place much larger orders in order to achieve a viable retail price point for the PoopPac. The new manufacturer is in place, samples approved, and in order to meet the manufacturing price point a large first order needs to be placed. The funds from this campaign will be used solely to fund the first production run of PoopPac's.
I am a self-funded start-up venture. All of the fundementals arein place
column2: design patent approved, utility patent pending. Trademarks are in place, website and on-line store are up, as is the PoopPac facebook page. Stores have contacted me wishing to carry PoopPac's, as soon as I can meet the required wholesale pricing. I have a qualified new manufacturer, and with this new manufacturer in place I can meet the target wholesale pricing and make PoopPac a viable business. Now all that is needed is inventory!!!

column1: I need to raise an additional $20,000 in order to place my first order for production quality tooling and for inventory to meet the factories minimum order requirement. Being a small startup, traditional funding isunavailable and I have exhausted my own resources getting my project this far. Accordingly I am here on Ideiegogo seeking your help. With your pledges to support this venture and pre-orders for PoopPac's we can move forward and provide a great tool to assist dog owners manage 'dinners past' with ease, style and convenience and reduce the negitive environmental impact of littered waste.

I have a small number of PoopPac's in stock to kick off this campaign. Thus to accommodatte early birds who would love a PoopPac, as a perk for supporting this project, in time for Christmas, I have set up this project as Flexible Funding so that I can ship Perks to the early birds immediately
Those of you that are not in a rush, your PoopPac thank you Perk is planned to be coming off the new production line and will be shipping no later than March 2013.

ALL PoopPac Dog Walkers Cases shipped as PERKS will include: Removable Wrist Strap, Removable adjustable Shoulder Strap, Built in Belt Clip, Installed 1 x Roll of Waste Bags, 1 x Installed Activate Charcoal Sachet.
PoopPacs and Similar Products Really Do Make a Positive Impact on Our Environment...
Did you know that in the USA alone there are over 70 million registered domestic dogs
column2: this is more dogs than the entire human population of the United Kingdom! With the ever increasing number of pet companions per household, the proper management of pet waste is a necessity. PoopPac's are designed specifically to make this task much easier and convenient. Those of us with dogs will appreciate the convenience, those of us without dogs will appreciate a clearer environment and perhaps gift a PoopPac to their dog loving friends or know your donation will assist me in meeting the many donnation requests I receive to donnate PoopPac's to worthy fundraisers. I have been particularly touched by the number of people with Service Dogs who love the design of PoopPac and who have reported how much it helps them better manage their dog's 'dinners past'.

column1: **PoopPac's currently ship with 100% degradable bags which are preinstalled. I will be upgrading to 100% compositable bags as soon as I have a new source in place that is logistically compatable with my new manufacturing facility.

Please share this campaign with all your dog loving friends, and any retail stores that you feel may be interested in learning about PoopPac's availability. Interest has already been shown in PoopPac internationally too, so please spread the word internationally as I welcome international orders and support. Thank You!

“As the reigning Miss Ethiopia, when I received word that I would be representing Ethiopia at the 63rd Miss World finals in Indonesia I was absolutely speechless! It has been a lifelong dream of mine to compete in an International pageant and now I have the opportunity to participate in the number one pageant of them all. With this comes a very high financial commitment and your support is needed. Please help me present the beauty of my country and my commitment to helping our young people through my charity initiatives!”

The Miss World pageant is the oldest surviving major international beauty pageant. It was created in the United Kingdom in 1951. Alongside its rivals Miss Universe and Miss Earth, this pageant is one of the most publicized beauty contests in the world with more than 2 billion viewers.

The winner spends a year traveling to represent the Miss World Organization and its various causes. In addition, it is a valuable opportunity for the winner to bring awareness of her country to the world. The current Miss World is Yu Wenxia of China. Traditionally, Miss World lives in London during her reign.

“I hope my participation in the biggest pageant in the world will inspire the youth of my country to never give up in pursuing their dreams. While I know it will be a major challenge I also am preparing myself for the experience of a life time!

As Ethiopia’s tenth delegate to this coveted event I follow a long line of successful young women who have gone on to have meaning lives and continue to make a impact upon the lives of so many people in the charitable causes they champion.
I wear the beauty, pride and heritage of my country upon my heart and appreciate your contribution to my journey in this epic event!”
If you can’t contribute anything please tell a friend, family member, or anyone who you feel might be interested in helping.

Please know that you can donate ANY dollar amount. Every donations helps!

column40:
>What is Lulea?

From  day one we have worked under our Do Good, Feel Good ethos. We believe that we can create a benchmark in the production standards of luxury leather goods under the ""Made in Kenya"" label.Founded by award-winning, internationally-acclaimed premium leather and accessories designer, Edmond Chesneau, Lulea is an enterprise for social impact which specialises in training Kenyan workers to master the craft of leather-work in order to create sustainable luxury leather goods of outstanding quality for the global market.

Who are we? 

Our workshop is based in Thika, Kenya. All handbags are made on location under the watchful gaze of our founder and master craftsman, Edmond Chesneau. 

The rest of the team are spread over Kenya, Ireland and the UK. We are small but with your help we are hoping to grow both on-the-ground and globally.
column43:
'>Who is Edmond Chesneau?

Edmond Chesneau began his career in Ireland as a designer under the tuition of a former master craftsman from internationally-renowned luxury leather goods house, Hermes. Mr. Chesneau’s 35 years’ experience coaching workforces in Ireland and Asia has helped him conceive a teaching model in the techniques and traditions of leather craftsmanship that he continues to pass to the Lulea trainee staff.

column1: ""For close to 40 years I have been in the business of designing, producing
and marketing leather accessories for luxury markets around the world.
Lulea gives me the opportunity to apply this life-long experience
into a meaningful business model in an environment that is now thankfully ready
The idea for Lulea started in 2011 when I was invited to Kenya to
design a range of products and to help set-up a production facility. While
assessing the existing local production in the region, I found that in most
cases the working conditions were, at best inadequate with tools and the
equipment sometimes non-existent. But what was most striking of all was that
there was practically no investment in training at all.
Today I can say that Lulea has possibly the best-equipped leather
The decision to call our facility a “Centre of Excellence” was made
to project excellence as a reference that illustrates our intention and
commitment at creating superior quality in products and services for our esteemed
customers. The “aim for excellence” is what I coach to our Lulea employees as I
believe it challenges everyone involved (including myself) to meet the best
possible standards and hopefully this is visible in the products we hand craft.
I have used the elephant in the Lulea logo as symbol of what I am
striving to achieve. The elephant is not a predator or a scavenger they are also
very social animals that pass knowledge through the accumulated experience of the
To me it is the perfect symbol for a triple-bottom-line business
model that can be simply expressed by saying, “Do well, do good and feel good

column4:
>

At Lulea we believe that by creating sustained and regulated employment for communities surrounding our facilities we can help to break deeply engrained cycles of poverty. 

Our partnership with the Baraka Womens Centre in Nairobi means that we can offer some of the most vulnerable members of the community the opportunity to gain independence and a usable skill that they can pass on to the wider region.
column6:
>Your Impact 

By purchasing a Lulea handbag you are actively helping to create a new way of looking at the production of luxury fashion in developing regions. 

By wearing your Lulea handbag and speaking to your friends about what we are achieving you are becoming an ambassador for change and development. 

If we reach our Indiegogo target we will be able to create new employment and grow the Lulea workshop in Thika, Kenya as well as our workforce throughout Africa and Europe.
column8:

By supporting Lulea through Indiegogo you are not only helping to grow

column1: our business you are also getting the opportunity to own one or more of our
beautifully made luxury handbags.  We know situations differ so we have
tried to create opportunities for everyone to support Lulea through our
Indiegogo perks.  At Lulea we never expect to get something for nothing so
each of our perks allow you to own a Lulea product, however big or small.

LIMITED EDITION INAUGURAL COLLECTIONS

Introducing the Lulea Karen Collection and the Lulea Kenyan Collections.

To commemorate the first production run of our inaugural lines the first 50 bags of each style ordered through Indiegogo will feature a commemorative leather patch that marks this bag as one of the first ever made in our Centre of Excellence in  Kenya. We are hoping these bags will become the collectors items of the future.
column6:
'>FAQ’s

When will I receive my order?
column8: '>We hope to delivery all products pre-ordered through Indiegogo by Sept / Oct 2014.
column14: '>What if I have a question that is not on the FAQ's?
column16:
'>Please send any questions you have to info@luxuryleatherafrica.com

How was Lulea founded?

Lulea was founded in 2011 by premium leather accessories designer Edmond Chesneau.  A trip to Kenya to teach a masterclass in leather craft techniques inspired Edmonds well honed entrepreneurial spirit. He decided to create a sustainable leather production house based in Kenya that would produce luxury goods for the global market.


What are the Lulea objectives?

To break the cycle of negative perception around ""Made in Africa"" labels by the production of sustainable luxury goods of a very high quality.  This will be achieved by growing the Lulea training and production Centre of Excellence and in doing so, transform lives in disadvantaged communities through training and employment.


Where is the Lulea Centre of Excellence based?

All Lulea bags are made in the Lulea workshop in Thika, Kenya. Thika is an industrial town located approximately 40 kms (25 mls) north east of Nairobi.

Where do you source Lulea raw materials?

Whenever at all possible all materials for the Lulea bags are sourced locally in Kenya. 

Who are the people making the Lulea bags?

The Lulea team are spread far and wide over both Kenya and Europe but those based in the workshop in Thika are made up of locally sourced skilled workers and Lulea trainees which we source from our partnership the WCI Baraka Womens Centre in Nairobi. Each member of the production team is taught personally by Mr Chesneau.

What is Lulea hoping to achieve?

As more and more of the worlds accessories are produced at a low price but with a high human cost, we aim to create a new business model that redresses imbalances in modern fashion production while offering fair wages and excellent working conditions to all Lulea team members. We hope that by offering the transfer of skills and employment to some of the most vulnerable members of the local community that we can be an agent for change and positively affect wider regional growth.

What are brainskinz, anyway?

brainskinz are fun, changeable recreational helmets that your kids will love to wear! brainskinz are colorful, playful and just plain fun. brainskinz can be worn while your kids are biking, skateboarding, scootering, sledding- pretty much any time they are in motion.  And when they get tired of a design, they can simply detach the current dome and choose another from their collection.  Keeping it fresh means keeping them on their heads!

How's it work?

Funny you ask, we happen to have some graphics to explain:



What exactly makes up a brainskinz helmet?

brainskinz helmets are made up of two parts and are attached by clips at front and back:

*base helmet, 3/4 front view

*base helmet, 3/4 rear view


The brainskinz base helmet (seen above) consists of molded EPS with a PVC covering, a dial-fit interior for an exacting fit and a side-buckling strap.  brainskinz base helmets are Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) certified, and will eventually come in two sizes that will fit kids of all ages.  Our 8+ Medium helmet will be ready in August, while the 5+ Small helmet should be ready by the end of the year.   The base helmet is where the interchangeable domes attach and here are some of the dome designs we've come up with:
column2:
/>

*Graphic designs by Boxing Clever along with the production of our hilariously offbeat introduction video 


The dome is secured to the base with injection molded plastic clips at the front and back.  The clips attach through the holes in the domes securing the dome to the base. These clips are practical and secure.  We also have some great plans for other uses in the future!

Did you guys get a prototype made?

As a matter of fact, we did.  In late 2012 brainskinz had a prototype produced in order to evaluate the aesthetics of our creation along with functionality- below is a pic:

What you see above is our base helmet in the middle with a hand-painted brain on top (obviously this will be a generated graphic at production).  Our prototype is rendered in pink but the production models will initially be available as you see in the base helmet photos above as glossy black brain on top of flat black.  Alongside are two early interchangeable dome designs, each with their respective graphic applied in a different fashion.  The domes initially attached at four points with 2-inch pieces of velcro at front, back and both sides. 

We came to the conclusion that our velcro fastening mechanism, while secure, was not ideal for securing the dome to the base helmet (the domes were difficult to remove).  So, over the next year we evaluated several different fastening scenarios.  We decided on the one below:


So, where are you now and where are you headed?

column1:
brainskinz manufacturer has tooled the molds necessary to manufacture our base helmets and interchangeable domes.  We expect product to begin manufacturing in early June with brainskinz helmets available in August.

In addition, brainskinz is working towards agreements with several licensors in the Major League Sports arena while creating what we feel is a unique retail business model to supplement our web store and retail placement possibilities.


WHICH BRINGS US TO OUR INDIEGOGO PROJECT:


brainskinz helmets Design Studio

brainskinz will create a section of our commerce website dedicated to user generated design by both children and adults.  We would like to foster creativity and will do so by allowing the brainskinz community to submit interchangeable dome designs which will then be vetted by the brainskinz team.  Designs will be posted for the community to vote and comment on, and some will be mass produced along with brainskinz designed domes!

We will create categories for design including age specific categories (i.e. 10 and under, 11-15, etc.) as well as student and professional design categories. If your design is chosen for production you will receive brainskinz merchandise and royalties for your work.

What do you need from ME?


Well, I'm glad you asked.  Our goal for this Indiegogo campaign is $20,000 and we will fund this expansion of our website with those funds.  We believe that great design can come from most anywhere and feel that a community centered around creating cool helmet design that kids will want to wear is a great extension of our core brand.

Please check out our Perk Levels on the right side of the page.  Any level of support is appreciated from $5 to $175!  

Note:  Support us at any level and ""like"" us on Facebook or sign up for our newsletter by clicking on the ""GET NOTIFIED"" tab at our website and receive a CODE for a FREE interchangeable dome along with your reward!

Meet Glade

Break free from the crowd, charge harder, and stay on the mountain longer. Gear with personality, for riders with personality.


OUR GOGGLES 

Lens: Polarized, anti-fog, anti-scratch treatment, UV protection and a extra large lens for broader visibility.

Frame: Highly flexible TPU frame that molds to your face and won't break.

Straps: Quickstrap™ system detachable straps for easy customization on the fly.
column11:
>

QUICKSTRAP™ AND QUICKLENS™ SYSTEMS 

Our Quickstrap™ and Quicklens™ systems allow for easy customization on the fly. Swap out your strap and lens in seconds anytime, anywhere. Dozens of unique combinations ensure you'll never get lost in the crowd.
column14:
>HOW AND WHY WE DO IT 

Glade was born out of our frustration with paying huge markups for our gear season after season. The ski industry is dominated by a small number of brands who use their influence to keep prices high. We avoid conventional retail avenues in order to deliver a product we believe in at a fair price.  

We sell directly to you.

We don't pay retailers to sell our gear so you don't have to pay their markups.

Say goodbye to the middleman.

Big brands use their name to charge exorbitant prices, we're different. 

We refuse to charge outrageous prices for our product. 

You probably have better places to spend your money, like buying another round for your friends.
column32:
>

By popular demand we are offering three exclusive color combinations. Check out the combinations below and don't forget to scoop an interchangeable polarized lens for added eye protection and a low light lens for variable conditions.
column47:
>About Us

We're a group of skiers and riders that were fed up with paying hundreds of dollars each season for new goggles and lens'. We knew there had to be a better way to get on the slopes and feel good about our gear and thus Glade was born. It's our mission to help people like us stay on the mountain longer and charge harder. We'd rather be spending our money on another round for our buddies than giving it away on overpriced gear, and we think you would too.

column1: need funding to jumpstart our initial production run. Our single biggest
cost is inventory and with your help we can continue to offer high quality gear at reasonable prices.
column5:
>We ship anywhere in the United States and Canada, for free.

We suggest you to get acquainted with new home footwear- Choonie, which will help create comfort at home, maintain health and get rid of tiredness after everyday work. Choonie is amazing home footwear made ​​of 100% natural sheep wool of the best quality, where the outsole is genuine sheepskin duplicated within the insole of merino wool.

Merino wool- is different from other breeds of sheep, having high quality of worsted wool, consisting of thin (15-25 microns) soft fibers. These sheep are slightly smaller in size, and therefore produce less wool, but in the pursuit of high quality, we decided to use wool of these particular rare breed sheep.
column6: >The most important advantage of Choonie is  the sheep wool, which has a
column8: >huge range of medicinal and health properties:

column1: • Products made ​​of sheep wool helps the human body to overcome more than twenty maladies -strengthen the immune and nervous systems, restore and normalize blood pressure and help prevent of chronic diseases.
• Natural products made ​​of sheepskin and sheep wool have great thermal insulation properties.
• Another unique feature of sheep wool is the magnificent moisture absorbing effect. Absorbing moisture of more than 33% of its own weight, sheep wool, remains completely dry.
• Sheep wool can not contain harmful microorganisms that can cause allergies, so its products are useful for adults and children.
• Sheep wool differs from other furs by its strength, practicality and universality, proved by centuries.
You can find some more information about merino wool here.
column2: >It is very important to notice that sheep wool is obtained by sheep-shearing, which does not harm the animals in any way. Moreover it helps them overcome the heat of summer days!

column3: >In exchange for your help, we are pleased to offer you:

column5: >Baby Choonie for babies up to 1 year.
column9: >Choonie for adults or teenagers (You will be able to choose the type, sizes  through a survey afterwards)

column1:
The perk options are on the right side of the page. If you have any questions or suggestions, do not hesitate to write in comments tab.

If you want to order a bigger amount of choonie, please contact us at: sales@choonie.com
We- are the people of a small country- Moldova, which is famous for wine
production, agriculture and handicrafts, as well as farming of goats and sheep.
These traditions are about our music, dance, national cuisine, manufacturing of
household items, and of course the creation of clothing and footwear.
As time passed, together with changes of political and economical
situation in Moldova, many things has changed, but we still remember and honor
our traditions. By choosing the best of them, we want to share our Moldova with

the rest of the world.

Describing choonie's characteristics, we once again convinced with the correctness of our decision in the promotion and development of these useful and necessary goods made of 100% natural sheep wool. For us, it is not just a commodity, not just a footwear.

Choonie for us is some kind of connection with the past of Moldova. Past, which we remember and are proud of. This is the knowledge that is useful and universal even in the rhythm of modern technologies and inventions. Choonie- for us is only a small step to get you acquainted with our Moldova.
Moldova became independent in 1992. So, 23 years is too little for the
formation of legally functional system, but too much for the loss of traditions
and culture. We're working to restore these traditions, and by the example of
the functional system of the modern world we help improve our economic and
commercial system (eg PayPal only introduces the possibility to use its payment
services in Moldova. Looking forward to the opportunity of receiving payments).
Unfortunately, the conditions of the unit export are not established by the law
properly, especially online sales abroad. In this regard, the last 3 months,
together with law firms, we found the only way of such possibility, namely,
making invoices and customs declaration for each package you ordered. However,
with your help, we’ll be able to provide this wonderful product, and other
products of natural sheep wool on more favorable terms. We will continue to
hold discussions with the tax authorities to speed up the development of legislation
that will simplify this task, and allow the whole world to learn about the

products of Moldova and its remarkable natural qualities.


At this point we are ready to take the first orders, and it will be just you!

","-ALL PERKS WILL BE SENT, NO MATTER THE % FUNDED!-ALL PERK PRICES INCLUDE  WORLDWIDE SHIPPING!We suggest you to get acquainted with new home footwear- Choonie, which will help create comfort at home, maintain health and get rid of tiredness after everyday work. Choonie is amazing home footwear made ​​of 100% natural sheep wool of the best quality, where the outsole is genuine sheepskin duplicated within the insole of merino wool.Merino wool- is different from other breeds of sheep, having high quality of worsted wool, consisting of thin (15-25 microns) soft fibers. These sheep are slightly smaller in size, and therefore produce less wool, but in the pursuit of high quality, we decided to use wool of these particular rare breed sheep.100% SHEEP WOOLThe most important advantage of Choonie is  the sheep wool, which has a huge range of medicinal and health properties:

Products made ​​of sheep wool helps the human body to overcome more than twenty maladies -strengthen the immune and nervous systems, restore and normalize blood pressure and help prevent of chronic diseases.
Natural products made ​​of sheepskin and sheep wool have great thermal insulation properties.
Another unique feature of sheep wool is the magnificent moisture absorbing effect. Absorbing moisture of more than 33% of its own weight, sheep wool, remains completely dry.
Sheep wool can not contain harmful microorganisms that can cause allergies, so its products are useful for adults and children.
Sheep wool differs from other furs by its strength, practicality and universality, proved by centuries.

You can find some more information about merino wool here.It is very important to notice that sheep wool is obtained by sheep-shearing, which does not harm the animals in any way. Moreover it helps them overcome the heat of summer days!
In exchange for your help, we are pleased to offer you:
Baby Choonie for babies up to 1 year.Choonie for adults or teenagers (You will be able to choose the type, sizes  through a survey afterwards)

The perk options are on the right side of the page. If you have any questions or suggestions, do not hesitate to write in comments tab.If you want to order a bigger amount of choonie, please contact us at: sales@choonie.comABOUT US

column1:
Head to www.topandderby.com to check out more info about the Chatfield cane!
We're just in the process of setting up the pre-order function on our website, so stay posted for more info. In the meantime, pop us a note (info@topandderby.com) to let us know if you are interested in getting a cane.

Now that our campaign has finished, there are many things that we will be doing over the next few days, weeks, and months to make sure that everyone gets the great products they ordered! Check it out…

>2. We will start working with our manufacturing partners to get the canes and coasters made. Throughout the process, we will keep everyone updated with our progress.

>3. We will start shipping products by the end of September, 2013, if not sooner! Shipping lead times will depend on the progress of our production. You can bet your bottom dollar though, that we won’t compromise the quality or products to make sure that everyone gets canes worthy of the Top &

Derby - The world needed a better cane"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/802234/pictures/full/20130509224928-Top___Derby_-_We_make_canes.jpg?1368164971"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp
column3: Derby - The world needed a better cane""/>

column1: For hundreds of years, walking sticks were common fashion accessories which were made and worn with pride. But as time went on, the aesthetics were abandoned and the finely crafted artifacts were replaced with cold, clinical, and impersonal items of utility. Today, most canes do little to inspire the self-confidence of those who use them. We aim to change this.

column2: Derby - Vintage Canes"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/750578/pictures/full/20130410184744-men_with_canes-indie.jpg?1365644867"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Imagine if you had to use a cane: How would you feel? How would other people perceive you?

column2: Derby, we don’t think that anyone should have to walk around with a gnarly looking cane
column3: it’s just not fair. We aren’t reinventing the wheel, we’re just designing beautiful canes that people are proud to own

column2: Derby - 3 canes leaning against wall"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724016/pictures/full/20130325220040-3_leaning_on_wall.jpg?1364274048"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Since the spring of 2011, we’ve designed and built countless iterations and prototypes. In doing so, we created a simple cane constructed of premium materials that will benefit a wide demographic of people. After getting feedback directly from cane users, we decided to move forward with our first model, the Chatfield. The reality is that canes are used by many different people…it’s not just your grandma or grandpa who carries a cane. Think about it
column2: injured athletes, post-operative patients, and yes, even celebrities like Brad Pitt, use walking canes when required.

Derby - People with canes"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724025/pictures/full/20130325220409-people_with_canes.jpg?1364274252"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: So now, we need your help. The Chatfield will be manufactured in North America, which we think is pretty rad. We’ve already established our manufacturing partnerships, and now we’d like to order our first production run of canes – with your help. By supporting us in our initiative, you can help us bring this vision to life. Let’s make canes fun again – together. Go talk to your grandma, go talk to your friend that busted her ankle doing the Harlem Shake, and let’s get people canes that they are proud to own. Heck, even your hipster buddy should get a cane, whether he needs one or not!

column2: Derby - Cane lifestyle"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724018/pictures/full/20130325220207-girl_with_cane.jpg?1364274135"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Why carry a cane, when you can wear it.

We start with a rigid core as the foundation for our cane handle. It’s cast in aluminum and then heat-treated, which produces an extremely durable, yet lightweight frame to build upon. The core is then over-molded with silicone, forming a soft continuous grip that conforms to your hand and dampens vibrations while you walk.

column2: Derby - Black cane handle"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724020/pictures/full/20130325220235-handle_black.jpg?1364274161"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: The finished handle has a distinct upturned nose which is comfortable to hold and intuitively positions the hand directly over the wood shaft. This unique detail also allows the cane to effortlessly rest against a wall for quick access
column2: it can be propped up on its nose or side, without the cane slipping or falling over as easily as generic canes often do.

Derby - Red cane leaning against wall"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724022/pictures/full/20130325220300-handle.jpg?1364274183"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp
column3: Derby - Red cane leaning against wall""/>

column1: The shaft is turned from solid American black walnut and finished with a durable coating to protect the wood and bring out the natural variation in the grain. We seal the deal by marking it with a laser engraved logo
column2: this way you know it’s an authentic Top &amp
Derby - Cane shaft detail"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724026/pictures/full/20130325220437-shaft.jpg?1364274285"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: The tip of the cane, or “shoe” as we like to call it, has a sneaker-inspired sole that’s molded in an abrasion resistant thermoplastic rubber. Overall, it’s replaceable, compact and sleek, and works great in a range of different conditions. We’re pretty sure your friends won’t have sneaker-inspired “shoes” on their canes.

column2: Derby - Cane shoe detail"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724027/pictures/full/20130325220512-shoe.jpg?1364274320"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Our story is simple: After having worked together for over 5 years, doing different aspects of product design and retail store design for one of North America’s most successful furniture manufacturers and retailers, we (Matthew Kroeker, Gerrit de Vries, and Ben Grynol) started collaborating to undertake small design projects together. By the spring of 2011, Top &
column2: Derby was born, with the vision of disrupting a stagnant industry that lacks innovation.

column1: As a team, we each have over 10 years of experience in different aspects of entrepreneurship, design, and business. Gerrit and Ben both have degrees in design, as well as MBAs from top-tiered Business schools, and Matthew has a degree in Industrial Design from one of North America's most prominent Design schools. Additionally, we are very fortunate to have two of the world’s leading business and design strategists, Roger Martin and Alexander Manu, as our advisors.
Most importantly, we are passionate about improving people’s lives by designing products that matter…and this is just the beginning.

After spending lots of time prototyping different models of canes, we are now at the point where we are ready to manufacture the product. With your support, we will be using the funds raised to set up molds for manufacturing, order our cane parts, and assemble and package each cane by hand in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. Our goal, however, is to ship products to supporters by September 30th, 2013. Regardless, we will update each supporter with our progress throughout the journey - you are part of the journey, and your support will help Top &

column2: Derby - Prototypes in the making"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/745031/pictures/full/20130407205329-prototypes.jpg?1365393212"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Like a house, a business is built from the ground up. Before the walls go up, a foundation has to be built. As a Ground Floor backer, you are the foundation. Your help is integral to our success by providing us with every bit of support that is needed! To show you how much we appreciate your support, we will be sending you a limited edition set of four Top &

column2: Derby - Laser Engraved Coaster"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/748825/pictures/full/20130409191559-laser-engraved-coaster.jpg?1365560164"" src="""" style=""margin-left: 45px

column1: Congrats! You will be one of the first supporters to own a T&
column2: D cane. Your support for our campaign makes up the Bricks and Mortar of our fundraising. We couldn’t launch our first model, the Chatfield, without you. As a B&amp
column3: M supporter, we will send you your choice of color (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) and size of our cane. Even if you don’t need a cane, you can still use it to putt, play air guitar, or sword fight. (Shipping to Canada &amp

column2: Derby - Chatfield cane black"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/727750/pictures/full/20130327200628-blurred-hand-handle.jpg?1364439992"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Whoa!! Hold your horses…you totally LOVE canes. Maybe you’re going to match them to your extensive shoe collection. Or, maybe you know a few people who need canes. Either way, it’s pretty cool that you want all three colors of our first model, the Chatfield. As a Raise the Roof supporter, we will send you all three colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our cane in the sizes you specify. (Shipping to Canada &

column2: Derby - 3 canes lifestyle"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/727753/pictures/full/20130327200706-holding_cane1.jpg?1364440028"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Maybe you own a Mom and Pop store, or maybe you’re gonna start your own pop shop. Whatever you do, we appreciate your support in getting so many canes! As a Mom and Pop supporter, we will send you the Ground Floor perk, as well as an assortment of 20 sizes and colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our first model, the Chatfield. Let us know the sizes &
column2: colors you want, and we’ll hook you up! (Shipping to Canada &amp

Derby - 3 canes on side"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/727748/pictures/full/20130327200539-3-handles_detail.jpg?1364439945"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: What the?? This is legit. You are gonna move some serious product! What the heck are you gonna do with 100 canes? Either you are a total cane hoarder, or you have big plans! As a Derby Mart supporter, we will send you the Ground Floor perk, as well as an assortment of 100 sizes and colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our first model, the Chatfield. Let us know the sizes &
column2: colors you want, and we’ll hook you up! (Shipping to Canada &amp
Derby - Canes random"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/724024/pictures/full/20130325220329-Main_random.jpg?1364274212"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: Risk 1: We raise a higher level of funds than expected and cannot keep up with demand.

Mitigation Strategy: Since we have spent almost two years developing many different models of canes, we have worked with many reputable manufacturers throughout North America. In doing so, we are aware of the maximum capacity of products that each of our manufacturing partners can supply us with on a monthly basis. Overall, the amount of product that each manufacturer can supply us with significantly exceeds our forecasted demand for our initial products.
Risk 2: Our production costs are higher than expected, and we can’t deliver the product.

Mitigation Strategy: In working with many different manufacturers to develop our canes, we have secured pricing for the production costs of our canes. Additionally, we have taken into account all of the extra costs that go into creating high quality products, such as finishing costs, packaging costs, and shipping costs.
Risk 3: Our production run of canes does not meet our standards.

Mitigation Strategy: Since we are all meticulous designers first and business people second, we do not settle for mediocrity. We can ensure that we will only ship the highest quality products to our supporters. If that means delaying production to get the right product out the door, we will do that – and we will let you know along the way through our progress updates. However, since we’ve been sourcing products from many different manufacturers over the past 18 months, the samples we’ve received to date have exceeded our expectations

column2: Derby - 3 canes full length"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/727734/pictures/full/20130327200048-3-canes-front-view.jpg?1364439653"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: What colours does the cane come in?
Our cane comes in three colours: Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, and Crybaby Blue.
What sizes does the cane come in?
Our cane comes in four sizes. The cane is fixed in length and non-adjustable, so use the chart below to find your size.

column2: Derby - Cane Sizing Chart"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/810859/pictures/full/20130514225156-Top___Derby_size_chart.jpg?1368597119"" src="""" style="""" title=""Top &amp

column1: How do I know what size cane I will need?
Please see the sizing chart above in the FAQ “What sizes does the cane come in?”.

Since the canes are made with solid walnut shafts, they are not adjustable and should not be cut to adjust the height. Each cane “shoe” (tip) will fit only on the end of the manufactured shaft, since it is a custom part which is made specifically for the cane.
How much weight can be supported by the cane?

Although the cane has not yet been tested by a third party to certify the maximum weight requirements that it can hold, we have tested the cane for weight and durability within our prototyping studio. However, a cane is not a device that is meant to support a person’s weight. Rather, it is meant to be used to assist a person with his or her balance, when required.

All of the cane parts will be manufactured at different facilities throughout Canada and the USA. However, the full cane will be assembled, finished, and packaged in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada – home of Top &

","As seen in...
Our campaign has finished, but the pre-ordering isn’t over!

Head to www.topandderby.com to check out more info about the Chatfield cane!We're just in the process of setting up the pre-order function on our website, so stay posted for more info. In the meantime, pop us a note (info@topandderby.com) to let us know if you are interested in getting a cane.

Now that our campaign has finished, there are many things that we will be doing over the next few days, weeks, and months to make sure that everyone gets the great products they ordered! Check it out…
1. We will follow up with everyone regarding the sizes and colors of canes that they would like to receive.
2. We will start working with our manufacturing partners to get the canes and coasters made. Throughout the process, we will keep everyone updated with our progress.

3. We will start shipping products by the end of September, 2013, if not sooner! Shipping lead times will depend on the progress of our production. You can bet your bottom dollar though, that we won’t compromise the quality or products to make sure that everyone gets canes worthy of the Top & Derby name.
We are Top & Derby, and we make canes.

For hundreds of years, walking sticks were common fashion accessories which were made and worn with pride. But as time went on, the aesthetics were abandoned and the finely crafted artifacts were replaced with cold, clinical, and impersonal items of utility. Today, most canes do little to inspire the self-confidence of those who use them. We aim to change this.
Imagine if you had to use a cane: How would you feel? How would other people perceive you?
At Top & Derby, we don’t think that anyone should have to walk around with a gnarly looking cane
column2: it’s just not fair. We aren’t reinventing the wheel, we’re just designing beautiful canes that people are proud to own

column1: Since the spring of 2011, we’ve designed and built countless iterations and prototypes. In doing so, we created a simple cane constructed of premium materials that will benefit a wide demographic of people. After getting feedback directly from cane users, we decided to move forward with our first model, the Chatfield. The reality is that canes are used by many different people…it’s not just your grandma or grandpa who carries a cane. Think about it
column2: injured athletes, post-operative patients, and yes, even celebrities like Brad Pitt, use walking canes when required.

column1: So now, we need your help. The Chatfield will be manufactured in North America, which we think is pretty rad. We’ve already established our manufacturing partnerships, and now we’d like to order our first production run of canes – with your help. By supporting us in our initiative, you can help us bring this vision to life. Let’s make canes fun again – together. Go talk to your grandma, go talk to your friend that busted her ankle doing the Harlem Shake, and let’s get people canes that they are proud to own. Heck, even your hipster buddy should get a cane, whether he needs one or not!
Why carry a cane, when you can wear it.

We start with a rigid core as the foundation for our cane handle. It’s cast in aluminum and then heat-treated, which produces an extremely durable, yet lightweight frame to build upon. The core is then over-molded with silicone, forming a soft continuous grip that conforms to your hand and dampens vibrations while you walk.

The finished handle has a distinct upturned nose which is comfortable to hold and intuitively positions the hand directly over the wood shaft. This unique detail also allows the cane to effortlessly rest against a wall for quick access
column2: it can be propped up on its nose or side, without the cane slipping or falling over as easily as generic canes often do.

column1: The shaft is turned from solid American black walnut and finished with a durable coating to protect the wood and bring out the natural variation in the grain. We seal the deal by marking it with a laser engraved logo
column2: this way you know it’s an authentic Top & Derby product.

column1: The tip of the cane, or “shoe” as we like to call it, has a sneaker-inspired sole that’s molded in an abrasion resistant thermoplastic rubber. Overall, it’s replaceable, compact and sleek, and works great in a range of different conditions. We’re pretty sure your friends won’t have sneaker-inspired “shoes” on their canes.
Team: Our story…who is behind Top & Derby?
Your product doesn’t determine your success

Our story is simple: After having worked together for over 5 years, doing different aspects of product design and retail store design for one of North America’s most successful furniture manufacturers and retailers, we (Matthew Kroeker, Gerrit de Vries, and Ben Grynol) started collaborating to undertake small design projects together. By the spring of 2011, Top & Derby was born, with the vision of disrupting a stagnant industry that lacks innovation.

As a team, we each have over 10 years of experience in different aspects of entrepreneurship, design, and business. Gerrit and Ben both have degrees in design, as well as MBAs from top-tiered Business schools, and Matthew has a degree in Industrial Design from one of North America's most prominent Design schools. Additionally, we are very fortunate to have two of the world’s leading business and design strategists, Roger Martin and Alexander Manu, as our advisors.
Most importantly, we are passionate about improving people’s lives by designing products that matter…and this is just the beginning.
What we need & what you’ll get

After spending lots of time prototyping different models of canes, we are now at the point where we are ready to manufacture the product. With your support, we will be using the funds raised to set up molds for manufacturing, order our cane parts, and assemble and package each cane by hand in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. Our goal, however, is to ship products to supporters by September 30th, 2013. Regardless, we will update each supporter with our progress throughout the journey - you are part of the journey, and your support will help Top & Derby achieve its success!

Like a house, a business is built from the ground up. Before the walls go up, a foundation has to be built. As a Ground Floor backer, you are the foundation. Your help is integral to our success by providing us with every bit of support that is needed! To show you how much we appreciate your support, we will be sending you a limited edition set of four Top & Derby coasters. (Shipping to Canada & USA included).

Congrats! You will be one of the first supporters to own a T&D cane. Your support for our campaign makes up the Bricks and Mortar of our fundraising. We couldn’t launch our first model, the Chatfield, without you. As a B&M supporter, we will send you your choice of color (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) and size of our cane. Even if you don’t need a cane, you can still use it to putt, play air guitar, or sword fight. (Shipping to Canada & USA included).

Whoa!! Hold your horses…you totally LOVE canes. Maybe you’re going to match them to your extensive shoe collection. Or, maybe you know a few people who need canes. Either way, it’s pretty cool that you want all three colors of our first model, the Chatfield. As a Raise the Roof supporter, we will send you all three colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our cane in the sizes you specify. (Shipping to Canada & USA included).

Maybe you own a Mom and Pop store, or maybe you’re gonna start your own pop shop. Whatever you do, we appreciate your support in getting so many canes! As a Mom and Pop supporter, we will send you the Ground Floor perk, as well as an assortment of 20 sizes and colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our first model, the Chatfield. Let us know the sizes & colors you want, and we’ll hook you up! (Shipping to Canada & USA included).

What the?? This is legit. You are gonna move some serious product! What the heck are you gonna do with 100 canes? Either you are a total cane hoarder, or you have big plans! As a Derby Mart supporter, we will send you the Ground Floor perk, as well as an assortment of 100 sizes and colors (Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, Crybaby Blue) of our first model, the Chatfield. Let us know the sizes & colors you want, and we’ll hook you up! (Shipping to Canada & US included).
Risk 1: We raise a higher level of funds than expected and cannot keep up with demand.

Mitigation Strategy: Since we have spent almost two years developing many different models of canes, we have worked with many reputable manufacturers throughout North America. In doing so, we are aware of the maximum capacity of products that each of our manufacturing partners can supply us with on a monthly basis. Overall, the amount of product that each manufacturer can supply us with significantly exceeds our forecasted demand for our initial products.
Risk 2: Our production costs are higher than expected, and we can’t deliver the product.

Mitigation Strategy: In working with many different manufacturers to develop our canes, we have secured pricing for the production costs of our canes. Additionally, we have taken into account all of the extra costs that go into creating high quality products, such as finishing costs, packaging costs, and shipping costs.
Risk 3: Our production run of canes does not meet our standards.

Mitigation Strategy: Since we are all meticulous designers first and business people second, we do not settle for mediocrity. We can ensure that we will only ship the highest quality products to our supporters. If that means delaying production to get the right product out the door, we will do that – and we will let you know along the way through our progress updates. However, since we’ve been sourcing products from many different manufacturers over the past 18 months, the samples we’ve received to date have exceeded our expectations
Drop us a line at info@topandderby.com!
What is your cane made of?
See the section titled “The Cane” above.
What colours does the cane come in?
Our cane comes in three colours: Lights-out Black, On-the-vine Red, and Crybaby Blue.
What sizes does the cane come in?
Our cane comes in four sizes. The cane is fixed in length and non-adjustable, so use the chart below to find your size.

Please see the sizing chart above in the FAQ “What sizes does the cane come in?”.

How much weight can be supported by the cane?

Although the cane has not yet been tested by a third party to certify the maximum weight requirements that it can hold, we have tested the cane for weight and durability within our prototyping studio. However, a cane is not a device that is meant to support a person’s weight. Rather, it is meant to be used to assist a person with his or her balance, when required.
Where will the cane be made?

All of the cane parts will be manufactured at different facilities throughout Canada and the USA. However, the full cane will be assembled, finished, and packaged in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada – home of Top & Derby.
Top & Derby is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.
Why did you start Top & Derby?
We started Top & Derby to improve people’s lives, to design products that matter, and to disrupt a stagnant industry.
The company was founded by Gerrit de Vries, Matthew Kroeker, and Ben Grynol.
Top & Derby was founded in the spring of 2011.
When will you be shipping product?
We expect to ship product to our supporters by September 30th, 2013.
Will I receive updates about the progress of Top & Derby over the course of the next few months?
How will the funds be used?
Please see the section above, titled: “What we need & what you’ll get”.

Yes, once we have fulfilled the orders of our supporters, we will be making product available to retailers and wholesale distributors.
We are currently only shipping to Canada and the US. We plan to ship internationally in the future.

Any word you can spread to family and friends would be a huge help and much appreciated! Even if you don’t need a cane, you can order one because they are seriously so fun to walk with! After being featured on TLC's Cake Boss wearing a dress I designed in 2001 I received numerous emails about selling it but I just couldn’t part with the one of a kind creation. However, it made me think.  It’s been 10 long years since my days at Lip Service and I truly miss fashion.
I’ve decided to start by making a sample line of Latex clothing. After my online announcement of this decision I received an offer to be featured in an undisclosed magazine by the end of the summer.
Here is why I need your help:

Latex is not a cheap material and I am unable to obtain it locally. Latex prices range from $8 to $30 a yard before shipping and supplies. Also with latex it’s a one shot fabric. If you cut incorrectly, tear or glue something wrong, it’s over! A whole new piece must be cut. The money donated will go toward fabric, patterns and other materials.
Please help by sending me any spare change you have to make my dream a reality.
If you don’t have any spare change its ok! You can help by liking my fan page, instagram and twitter accounts to raise awareness of my arts. You can also share this page!

Scruffy showed up at the door step of my business partner, Steve, about 2 years ago… and he never left.  After unsuccessfully trying to find a bath for Scruffy, the idea for the Barking Bath was formed.  Since then, the bath has gone through several versions and prototypes until we finally hit upon the right formula…  a bath with walls about the height of the dog and a separate floor piece with a latching system to help keep him in.  After we succeeded in building the bath for a small dog, we took it further.  We wanted a bath that a larger dog could simply walk right in - no lifting.  Then we thought about what to do with the bath when not in use - would it just sit in the garage taking up space?  And in its fully assembled state, the shipping costs were a small fortune due to dimensional weight pricing.

Well, we solved all of the problems we identified.  The Barking Bath will ship in a 6 inch high box and that eliminates the extra dimensional weight fees.  It can normally be assembled in about 90 seconds and disassembled just as fast for easy storage.  The Stay Assist feature helps keep your dog in the bath while each end of the bath can be lowered and raised to make it surprisingly easy to bring your dog in and out.

We will build each Barking Bath with quality materials.  Yes, it does cost a little extra to use good materials but we think it’s worth it.  The Barking Bath will last a lifetime - and we are backing it up with a full 5 year warranty that covers all components of the bath - including the vinyl liner!

Since we will be using an ultra strong PVC Frame and an extra thick Vinyl Liner (20mil), there isn’t much chance you’ll ever need to use our 5 year warranty with normal use of the bath - but it’s nice to know that if something does happen, you pay nothing to get it fixed (except shipping costs of course).

The Barking Bath has a drain with a drain cap.  You can use it as a true bath with the cap on.  Or use it like a shower with the cap off for continuous draining.  If you want the water to drain away from the bath, a standard garden hose can be attached to the drain allowing you to drain the bath to any location inside or outside.  And speaking of inside and outside, you can use the Barking Bath anywhere.  Just keep in mind that there is still a possibility of some splashing - so don’t use it near an area that can’t handle a little splash now and then.

WHAT IS VYBE ALL ABOUT?

Vybe is bringing a taste of personality and creativity that the sunglass industry is currently lacking. With Vybe’s interchangeable features, people can now buy sunglasses that are more in tune with their tastes and their personality.  


Vybe’s customizable options allow for over 1.9 million different color combinations, so people can create a pair of sunglasses that is unique to their own tastes. The time is over seeing someone next to you wearing the same shades.

where you can customize and view prospective pairs (similar to Nike ID) to tell
us the color combinations you would like.
We currently have twelve different colors available for the
glasses for every part.  We also have
the Master Collection reward, you will get the opportunity to put together over
1.9 million different pairs of Vybe Sunglasses.
What happens if your goal isn’t reached?
We have back-up investors in place to ensure we reach our goal. Therefore, if we only raise part of our amount on Indiegogo, the rest of the funding will come privately.
I want to know more about Vybe.  Who can I contact? Do you have a website?
info@vybesunglasses.com with any and all questions. Yes, gander over to www.vybesunglasses.com to check out our site!
Where can you find us on social media?
Holler at us on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram @vybesunglasses and we might
reply back with a little discount or free gear. You never know until you try.",21.0,0,"1 Campaign

The World's Only Custom Fit Anatomical Men's Underwear
We need your support in launching our truly innovative collection that will disrupt the Men's Underwear Industry.

The SilkSuit LLC is proud to offer the ultimate underwear experience for Men.  We created a new revolutionary innovation that is simple, elegant, sexy and may provide a solution to increase and reinvigorate lost virility.
It's going to make you laugh - so do so. It's funny so you should be laughing. We do. Make note of the energy this brings when you tell friends!
It's Here. Custom Fit Men's Anatomical Underwear

We have to be a little crazy obviously, but the background of the company is in designing, developing, selling and implementing Custom Global Trading Systems for Financial Services, literally, all over the world. Groomed in systems and efficiency, a best friend and I found a flaw in Men's Underwear and were immediately convinced we had something.
After all, I wear socks and STILL have a callous on both big toes! So being circumcised, not covering the little guy had to have an effect - and not a good one. Logical right?

This flaw is an opportunity to educate, and provide a solution to hundreds of millions of Men, creating a new market within the global men’s underwear industry. 
For Men, the pleasure ""control center"", the Glans, the head constantly rubs against the underwear. We call this the ‘sandpaper effect’.

Due to this constant, day after day, week after week, Year after Year, DECADE AFTER DECADE subtle abrasion - this ""sandpaper effect"" causes the delicate nerve endings and blood vessels that are the source of the pleasure sensation for men, to move further and further away from the surface - forming, essentially, a ""callous"". A layer of Keratin (protein in hair and nails) forms just beneath the skin.

This thickness causes a loss of sensation. The new sensations don't ""tickle"" but a deeper more satisfying experience. An example is putting a supercharger or turbos on a muscle car. Does it need it? Maybe not, but superchargers and turbos are cool and make the muscle car perform even better. That's the essence of the SilkSuit.

The SilkSuit is Custom Fit Anatomical Men’s Underwear, a double layered sheath of the finest stretchable, breathable fabric. Like a second skin. The SilkSack is a pouch of the same fabric for the ‘boys’. The SilkSuit stays on by super soft secure Baby elastic. (Ever see a baby with blue feet?)
The SilkSuit+ comes with an opening to make going to the bathroom simple and quick.
The SilkSuit is custom fit like an expensive Suit tailored to fit your body – made for you!

A this is huge for you. jockstraps are abrasive. Burlap. change it up and experience that extra boost of 'young legs', extra energy like Pacino in ""Raging Bull"" (no foolin around before a fight!), bounce in your toes! That kind of energy or 'extra step'.
Hey NIKE! Are you there?! (two layers means - NFL, NHL, NCAA, MLB, and even English Premiere League Football!) The SilkSuit is the 'new jockstap'! with logos! Let's GO!
We have plenty of styles to come!
Your Help will bring the revolution in men's underwear and possibly all of  these new benefits to men EVERYWHERE:
• 5.       Protects against Long Term Abrasion aka “The Sand Paper      Effect”
• 7.       A feeling of security (new sensation for men circumcised since birth)
• 8.       Medical Research Initiative to Identify Additional Target  Markets that may benefit
•                              iii.      Men with low Testosterone level
•                              iv.      Military Survivors of Explosive Devices
(we have not found studies that are in this specific area. If none exists we will explore the effects on Men).
- Cost of Production of First Run
- Production of three 30 Secs video commercials by They Said...Productions.
- Launch Line to create a new market and bring potential benefits to millions of men worldwide - and bring LOVE back!
An email with simple measuring instructions will be sent so that accurate sizing is submitted.  That part is really important. Simple and Easy.
This project was TOO HOT for Kickstarter! GOGO INDIEGOGO!

Once the campaign has closed you will receive a link and credentials to log in to the site (pre launch) to enter your sizes and mailing information. We'll keep you informed with the status of your order via email.
Please spread the word - it will be UNIQUE and your friends will be so jealous you found something TRULY UNIQUE on the INTERNET!!
Grady Wilson, Director of Security (no break ins)
